19568006.review:
[h1]Beyond Good & Evil[/h1]

An amazing game with a good story and very likable characters. It also has an open world for you to explore. The gameplay focusses mostly about stealth, which gets pretty intense sometimes IMO. There's also alot of fighting but there isn't much depth in that. Meaning that there's only one button you use to attack and one to evade. You can also charge up your attack to make it more powerfull, but that was only useful in rare occations. Along the way you have to make pictures of animals(believe me it's more rewarding than you think) to receive credits(a currancy). You can also drive a hovercraft, which is your main form of transportation throughout the game. The soundtrack of this game is very fitting and is very well made.

[b]PC issues[/b]
Anyway, the PC version has some issues with the camera, textures and the screen ratio. Although the textures and screen ratio issues are easily fixable with some google searching. Unfortunately the camera problem is unfixable as far as I know. It doesn't completely break the gameplay though.

[b]The verdict [/b]
This game creates a vast new universe in gaming, and it is one of my favourites. I have replayed this game many times, and I wasn't bored once. If you love action/adventure games with a good set of characters and story, than this is a must buy!

19528774.review:
[i]Jade je mladá a krásná zeleonooká dívka, která žje se svým strýcem v sirotčinci v majáku na planetě Hillys. Její rodiče zemřeli v boji proti DomZ, mimozemské invazivní civilizaci. A když jednou DomZ napadnou i Hillys, maják je zbořen a sirotci jsou uneseni invazivními jednotkami. Po těchto událostech Jade rychle dospívá a přestává nosit růžové brýle. Vydává se na cestu velkého dobrodružství, jehož cílem je osvobození sirotků ze zajetí DomZ. Ale cestou se zamotává do pavučin odboje, jehož právoplatným členem se rychle stává. Pomocí svých fotografií pak odhaluje různá zvěrstva vojáků Alpha Sections a začíná podněcovat revoluci, proti těm zkorumpovaným šaškům v uniformách. Kam až ji odboj zanese? A kdo skutečně stojí za všemi těmi dezinformacemi?[/i]

Beyond Good & Evil je akční adventura, která nás zavede mimo Zemi do vzdálené budoucnosti, kdy je lidstvo rozděleno na milionech planetách. Příběh se odehrává na těžařské planetě Hillys, kde kromě lidí žijí i jiní humanoidi (kozy, prasata, žraloci i hroši a kočky). Hráč se ujímá vedení hlavní hrdinky, Jade (čti Jiejd). Hillys je celá planeta, ale prakticky se skládá z jediného přístavu a okolního moře. Po moři se pohybuje hráč pomocí vznášedla. Aby se však dostal hráč do ostatních oblastí, musí si kupovat upgrady vznášedla za perly. A zisk perel, to je samostatná kapitola. Hráč má mnoho příležitostí perly nacházet. Buď na tajných místech během misí, nebo je dostává za odměnu od obyvatel, když dokončí část příběhu. Nebo si je může vydělat za fotografie fauny planety Hillys. A právě fotografování různých zvířat je velmi zábavné. Zvířata jsou poschovávána v různých částech planety a někdy od hráče vyžadují speciální postup, aby se vyfotografovat dala.

Po grafické stránce hra není příliš kompatibilní s novým hardwarem i softwarem a tak některé světelné efekty vypadají příšerně a rozblikají celou obrazovku. Šílená ja také kamera, která je vždy v nějakém bodu a hráč musí měnit klávesy pro pohyb při každé její změně. Někdy je to vážně v dost hloupých úhlech.

Po herní stránce je hra chytlavá a přináší různé aktivity (závody vznášedel, adventuru, fotografování, sbírání perel). To rozhodně zyšuje její hratelnost. Příběh není vůbec špatný a i když je krásně předvídatelný, přináší pár zajímavých zvratů. Možná mladší hráče už hra nepřitáhne, ale starší hráči rádi uvítají francouzskou klasiku od studia Ubisoft. 7/10

19422511.review:
Jedna z najlepszych "starych" gier, które widziałem i grałem.
Jest cała po angielsku i nie ma wbudowanego spolszczenia, a bez znajomości angielskiego nie zrozumiesz tej gry w 100%, może w jakiś 20% tak.
Wersja na steama jest zbugowana graficznie, a także niektóre rzeczy, które były trudne dla mnie gdy grałem w wersję z płyty (kupiłem steamową tylko dlatego, że płyta mi się popsuła) były teraz praktycznie prościutkie, nie wspominając, że najtrudniejszą walkę z bossem ostatnim, którą próbowałem robić masę razy teraz przeszedłem za pierwszą próbą, nie wiem czy to dlatego, że już jestem doświadczony, czy ta wersja jest uproszczona, ale zauważyłem nawet, że "zagadka" ostatnia przed walką z bossem, była uproszczona i to mega, wystarczyło kliknąć tylko 2 przyciski po 1 z 3 faz żeby przejść.

Jeśli pominołeś to co napisałem, to w skrócie, jeśli masz możliwość kupienia tej gry poza steamem, to zapewne będzie ona lepsza niż ta, którą tu kupisz, a w streszczeniu plusów i minusów gry:

Plusy:
+świetny sountrack w większości gry
+fabuła jest ciekawa, szkoda tylko, że mało jej :P
+grafika jak na 2004 rok, jest wybitna

+gra jest pod skradanie się, lecz jest ono nie trudne, chodź czasami trzeba ruszyć głową, żeby przejść

Minusy:
-krótka
-nie ma kontynuacji i zapewne nie będzie
-wszystko co było kiedyś dla mnie trudne, było tym razem dla mnie bardzo łatwe
-troche bugów związanych z grafiką jest w steamowskiej wersji

Czy opłaca się kupić? Tak, w granicach do 20zł. Jest ona grą którą się nie zapomina (w dobrym znaczeniu)

Jeśli nie przekonadzą was moje słowa to macie tutaj świetną recenzję gry w formie filmiku https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O27Iv3T6wwg

19421273.review:
[b]Jedna z najlepszych gier, w jakie kiedykolwiek grałem.[/b]

Sądzę, że to oświadczenie powinno Cię zachęcić do zakupu.
...
Ty dalej tutaj?
Za mało? Nie przekonałem Cię?

W takim razie - posłuchaj. Beyond Good and Evil ma jeden z najlepszych soundtracków w historii gier.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jTdcJWDNsao

Spodobało Ci się, co?
W takim razie przejdźmy jeszcze do konkretów - mojej recenzji.
[i](bez spojlerów)[/i]

"Wojna zawitała do bram Hillys."
Takim zdaniem wita nas gra. Później następuje wyjaśnienie obecnej sytuacji na Hillys - planecie, na której toczy się akcja. Wspaniałomyślne oddziały Alfa zapewniają jej ochronę przed złowrogimi DomZ (kosmitami). My natomiast wcielamy się w postać zielonowłosej reporterki Jade, która wraz z wujkiem (bekonkiem), próbuje utrzymywać pseudo-sierociniec dla dzieci, które straciły rodziców podczas wojny.
Dziwne połączenie, nie? Komedio-dramat? Mam się śmiać, czy płakać? Aj Ty żartownisiu, tożto synkretyzm gatunkowy w grze! To połączenie nie jest dziwne, ono jest wspaniałe. Śmieszne momenty, o dziwo, śmieszą, a te smutne - smucą. To ta wybuchowa mieszanka sprawia, że gra... działa. Naprawdę działa. 

"Beyond... co?"
Nie chcę się za bardzo rozpisywać, bo to mogłoby was (Wspaniałomyślnych Czytelników) po prostu znudzić, a jak dobrze wiemy - takie recenzje są zwyczajnie pomijane. Dlatego rozpiszę się krótko.
Po raz pierwszy spotkałem się z BG&E, gdy byłem malutkim dzieckiem. Dostałem w prezencie CyberGRĘ (R.I.P.), a wraz z nią ten cudowny tytuł. Grę próbowałem przechodzić... no cóż, kilkanaście razy. Zamiast rozwiązywać logiczne zagadki, wolałem podziwiać naturę i świat wykreowany przez twórców, lub grać w mini-gierki (które, oczywiście, do niczego pożytecznego nie prowadziły). Stałem się poszukiwaczem ukrytych dialogów, miejsc, i znajdziek. To tylko świadczy o tym, że ten tytuł jest bardzo rozbudowany. Ma przeciekawe postacie, bogatą fabułę, cudowny świat.. w sumie, weźmy to ładnie rozpiszmy.

[h1]PLUSY I MINUSY[/h1]
[u]Plusiki :)[/u]
+ Ciekawa fabuła i dobrze przemyślany scenariusz
+ Przejmujące losy głównej postaci
+ Główna postać (tak, potrzebowałem na to aż dwóch plusów)
+ Postacie poboczne, które zapadają w pamięć
+ Spory świat, którego fauna zadziwia mnie do dzisiaj
+ Niepowtarzalny klimat
+ Najlepszy soundtrack
+ Poruszona problematyka
+ Bardzo dobra grafika i modele postaci (jak na standardy 2003 roku)
+ Niezły voice acting (dubbling - przyp. tłum.)
+ Różnorodni przeciwnicy
+ Oryginalne i kreatywne rozwiązania, których brakuje w innych grach
+ Pey'j, który macha ręką, gdy robi mu się zdjęcia

[u]Minusiki :([/u]
- Zmarnowany potencjał (Ubisoft nie wyłożył wystarczająco dużo pieniędzy oraz olewa fanów, którzy domagają się kontynuacji)
- Dużo glitchy (Steam wrzucił jedną z najgorszych wersji gry i ma wywalone na to, jaki jest jej stan. Na szczęście większość da się ręcznie naprawić)
- Sporadyczne spadki FPSów
- Niektóre pułapki, bądź części rozgrywki, wydają się być skierowane do młodszych odbiorców
- Powtarzalność etapów (niewielka, ale jednak)

TL;DR
- Czy warto kupić tę grę?
- To... 

[b]Jedna z najlepszych gier, w jakie kiedykolwiek grałem.[/b]

19031334.review:
Beyond Good and Evil - игра от всеми известной компании Ubisoft, которая была выпущена в далёком 2003 году. Я познакомился с ней примерно в 2004-2005 годаз, когда был ещё совсем юн и зелен, да и малых размеров, в то время как мой компьютер, а точнее монитор от него - был огромным, если вы понимаете о чём я :) 

Познакомила меня с этой игрой - крёстная, которая в один день подарила мне диск с игрой, в последствии так глубоко сохранившейся у меня в памяти...
 
   Из-за чего? Не знаю, но попробую пояснить :D

 1. Для того времени это была шикарная графика, не самая простая для меня тогда  игра, а даже наоборот: довольная тяжёлая... хотя, вру, даже сегодня тяжко, ведь я по жизни не умею играть в стеллс игры, хочется мне экшона, что ж поделать-то :D 

2. Мне очень нравилось разнообразие животного мира в игре, каждого представителя которого я должен был фотографировать за награду. Это было довольно таки интересно... 
Разнообразие врагов - тоже неплохое, кастомизация главного героя, отсутствует, но...
 ...но мне очень понравилась проработка некоторых героев, а больше всего понравилась анимация волос Джейд :)

 3. Озвучка. Я до этого никогда не играл в игры с отстающей озвучкой. Знаете, так тем, кто русифицировал игру можно понять героев лучше, прочувствовать их  сильнее, понять их страдания, но, как мне кажется русский перевод удачнее чем английский. 

  Пример : После того как был разрушен маяк послушайте сначала английскую, а потом русскую озвучку Джейд.

 
 4. Открытый мир. Согласитесь, не будь открытого мира, нам бы не было так интересно играть. Этого самого открытого мира не хватает в очень многих играх...
  Не вижу смысла объяснять, но для вида могу привести сравнение :
Need For Speed Undorground и Need For Speed Undorground 2. В первой части мы просто проходим гонки, а во второй дам в распоряжение дают целый город, в котором можно делать всё что душе угодно.
   
 Игра, как одна из моих первых и, однозначно, любимых игр, получает заслуженные 10 возможных баллов из 10, вот только жаль, что продолжения мы так и не увидели..

19028310.review:
So here's this game I played several times on the PS2, and it is SO FUN. PC is no exception.

People may have seen the camera on the box art back in the day and said to themselves "Ew! Camera in the gameplay, no way!" Sure the camera is sometimes a necessary part of the game, but combat and stealth are major gameplay elements that shouldn't be overlooked.

The story centres on Jade and Pey'j, in a strange world where half-animal people walk around on two legs and talk. For example Pey'j has a definite boar-like appearance. The world is under siege from the Domz armada, and the Alpha Sections are there to stop them. During an attack Jade discovers she's out of credits and her lighthouse shield power is cut off. In an effort to make some credits she takes on a photography job for the local science centre, and through a turn of events ends up working for a secret underground movement called the Iris Network.

The plot is fairly straightforward - you go on missions looking for evidence, once you find the evidence you take photos of it, and then you get the hell outta there. The missions are few and large, and the best way to approach it is to go sneaky stealth mode on everything. It is possible to attack your enemies too, but you will have a hard time.

Gameplay combat is all 3rd-person, but not all of it is melee. There are battles on the water inside your 'tugboat', and towards the end of the game there is even a spaceship battle, which I thoroughly enjoyed. Enemies hit hard in melee combat though, so it pays to grab all the health upgrades you can find. These can be manually distributed to your companion too if you think they need it. As already mentioned, subterfuge is your friend - you will have more fun with sneak attacks and trickery than trying to face-tank your way though the game.

Other gameplay elements include speed-races to get your stolen credits back, minigames (that game in the Akuda Bar is badass hard), finding all the species to photograph for more credits, finding all the pearls for more vehicle upgrades. There are a couple of foot-chases too, to add whipped cream to an already delicious cake of a game.

So how delicious is it? Well the music is a blast for starters. It has a wonderful style to it, melodious and alien. Well-suited to the game. The graphics are a little bland but good - with a main character like Jade it makes sense there's a bit of a green theme to it. Voice-actors have been cast well, there is a lot of great voice-acting in the game and it helps to suspend disbelief, helping immersion and reinforcing our empathy towards the characters.

Highly recommended to anyone that loves stealth, a great story, or just wants to try something new. The hours I've played it on PC are not representative of my total hours (PC and PS2). Worth it just for the soundtrack!

18933711.review:
Los mas veteranos y jugones recordareis esta maravilla del 2003 de Ubisoft , por desgracia no todo el mundo sabe apreciar el arte hecho videojuego. Beyond Good and Evil™ es un juego sobresaliente y de culto poco conocido, en su día no tuvo grandes ventas a pesar de sus buenas críticas, debido en parte a la poca publicidad que se le dio por la competencia de otras sagas, como Prince Of Persia y Splinter Cell, la época dorada de Ubisoft. El mismo Peter Jackson destaco el gran trabajo realizado por los programadores y la calidad del título, también gano varios premios como Juego del Año y Mejor Argumento, a pesar de todos estos elogios el juego no vendio lo suficiente, su supuesta secuela fue anunciada en el 2008 y la información que se tiene es muy escasa, una auténtica lástima para los que hayamos disfrutado de este grandísimo juego.


LO MEJOR:

- Mezcla de muchos géneros bastante lograda (sigilo, plataformas, acción, puzzles, conducción...)
- Buen ritmo de juego y desarrollo de la historia.
- El argumento y los personajes, de cine.
- Gran doblaje al español y banda sonora.
- Jugabilidad muy variada, nunca tendras la sensación de estar haciendo lo mismo.
- La ambientación del planeta Hillys, con sus propios habitantes y su fauna.
- Para la época era un juego técnicamente impecable.

LO PEOR:

- Corta duración, unas 8 horas.
- No supone ningún reto en ninguna de sus fases, quizás demasiado sencillo.
- Que apenas se sepa algo de la secuela, 7 años después de haberse anunciado.


Tiene un buen ritmo narrativo y una historia interesante, personajes carismáticos y una genial ambientación, el planeta Hillys esta lleno de vida. El juego en si es muy ágil, rara vez nos atascaremos en alguna zona o tendremos problemas para superar una fase, esto afecta claramente a su duración, en unas 7-8 horas podremos terminar la historia principal, para muchos se les hara corto, a pesar de esto es un juego que merece ser disfrutado y recordado, con un apartado técnico muy bueno que no dara problemas en ningún PC, una gran experiencia en el mundo de los videojuegos. La verdad, da mucha nostalgía y a la vez lástima ver como hace unos cuantos años los juegos estaban verdaderamente trabajados y eran capaces de tenerte horas enganchado a la pantalla solo por su historia, hoy en día todo se reduce a unos buenos gráficos y a unas mecánicas continuistas, sin apenas innovación... bienvenidos a la era comercial. También da mucha pena ver lo que era Ubisoft antes y lo que es ahora.


NOTA FINAL: 9

18817256.review:
Pahat avaruusoliot pommittavat vesipitoisen Hillys-planeetan kamaraa, maan asukkaille syötetään propagandaa ihmiskunnan voitosta ilkeitä muukalaisia vastaan. Kun salaperäinen liikemies tarjoaa rahakasta kuvauskeikkaa Jade-sankarille, jonka sikamaisella ystävällä on sattumoisin rahahuolia. Nuori Jade tarttuu tuumasta toimeen, mutta pelin edetessä hänelle paljastuu pian, ettei planeettaa suojelemaan lähetetyt joukot eivät välttämättä ole sittenkään niin puhtaita pulmusia kuin annetaan ymmärtää.

Toiseen käteen lyödään kamera ja toiseen puinen taistelusauva ja matka käy aina kaupunkien, tehtaiden ja slummien poikki. Paikasta toiseen päästä huristellaan sikamaisen ystävämme Pey'j-enon ilmatyynyaluksella, jota päivitetään tarvittaessa lisäosilla, kuten hyppymoottorilla ja järeämmillä tykeillä. Maksutapana toimivat harvinaiset helmet, joita löytyy ympäristöstä.

Pelin vanhentunut grafiikka ei ole liian karua ja tempo pitää pelaajan otteessaan. Pelimaailman omaperäisyys ja sen eläimelliset ystävät tuovat aina hymyn suulle. Beyond Good and Evil antaa kokemuksen, jota jää miettimään läpäisyn jälkeen.

18813549.review:
One  of the best and most beautiful game of all times, and i'm not even blinded by nostalgia to say this, i played this game when i was a kid and it was a terrific experience, and even now as an adult this game is still awesome and a more then welcome journey =D
Well the plot of the game can be really simple at first, but it gets better as you progress through the game, gameplay mechanics are as smooth as it could be, the combat is simple but is really satisfying once you get used to it. 
The graphics are really beautiful for it's time, Jade is a beautiful and strong protagonist that doesn't play around when working, she gets things done.
Plot: The game starts with the alpha section giving a speech to the Hylians about their job protecting the planet from the evil alien race called the Doomz, there is a war between these aliens and the military forces of the Hyllis. A alien invasion happens and Jade is introduced in the game, after they dealt with the aliens, Jade meets with a strange man called Mr De Castellac. Jade meets with a rebel organization and starts unravelling conspiracies about the government to discover and expode their dirty secrets.
The Game is fantastic don't be afraid to buy it guys, it is worth your money.
There is some compatibility issues, but they can be easily fixed.
9/10 <3 <3

18763916.review:
2003 fue un gran año para los videojuegos y nos dejó muchas joyas.Esta obra sin embargo por esa época no tuvo el reconocimiento (en lo que a ventas se refiere) que se merecia,y es que ubisoft estaba en plena forma en ese momento y lo demostró de sobremanera con el videojuego "Beyond good and evil" que nos cuenta una historia nueva como pocas y ademas interesante.

no solo eso,los escenarios sin ser abiertos son bastante grandes y nos permite explorar a gusto,el doblaje al castellano es sublime (debo reconocer algun altibajo secundario)pero es que es una gozada artísticamente,los movimientos de jade la protagonista son fluidos (para aquella epoca es espectacular) como pocos,los combates lo mismo,hay secciones de sigilo en las que sientes mayor satisfaccion que con el mismo metal gear,la trama es buena y los personajes memorables (la mayoria,porque hay algunos que """Meeeeeh""".me encantan los graficos del juego a medio camino entre 3d y animación con esos escenarios tan inspirados y las fases en las que no hay musica que relajan un monton,la BSO es jodidamente buena.

sin embargo vendió muy poco por falta de marketing y...bueno...una nueva Ip en tiempos de final fantasy x-2 (cuyo estilo artistico me recuerda bastante) DMC2 y the simpsons hit&run era previsible que no vendiera tanto,sin embargo la critica siempre lo tachó de excelente y lo que en su tiempo era "Un juego mas"se ha encasillado como una aventura épica.

sobre el final sin entrar en spoilers,es lo que peor me ha dejado del juego,me pareció poco inspirado y demasiado corto,pero si logras que eso te de igual,es un gran juego muy divertido y accesible.

no veo razón para no recomendarlo,y esperar que salga el 2.

18729663.review:
Quand on joue à Beyond Good and Evil, on se dit d'emblée : "ça ressemble à Zelda". Et c'est tout à fait légitime de le penser, car on y retrouve à peu près les mêmes mécanismes : on fait un donjon, on y trouve un artéfact, et bien sur, on se retrouve face à un boss qui se trouve être vulnérable au dit objet. Mais se limiter à une comparaison bête et méchante serait une grave erreur, car BGE est bien plus que ça.

Véritable ode à l'écologie, c'est avant tout un univers riche, des personnages attachants, une histoire captivante, de l'infiltration, des courses endiablées et un gameplay tellement bien pensé qu'on aimerait en avoir davantage. Et oui ma bonne dame, tout ça à la fois dans un même jeu, c'est presque du vol !
Et comme si cela ne suffisait pas, la quête secondaire consistant à prendre les créatures en photo ne lasse jamais, et on se surprend à préparer l'appareil photo dès le début d'un combat afin de compléter sa collection.

En ce qui concerne les combats d'ailleurs, Jade, qui est soit dit en passant une combattante expérimentée, sera accompagnée la plupart du temps par un compagnon d'arme qui, bien qu'anecdotique par moments, sera d'une aide précieuse pour se sortir de situations épineuses. Quant aux boss, ils vous opposeront une résistance acceptable sans pour autant être insurmontables (excepté un, qui rappelera de mauvais souvenirs à celles et ceux qui font fait le jeu).

Malheureusement, et suite à un echec commercial, le jeu qui était pensé comme une trilogie (ce qui explique en partie sa faible durée de vie) ne connait pas de suite à ce jour, bien que des images et autres trailers trainant ici et là sur la toile laissent envisager le contraire. Esperons seulement pouvoir un jour suivre à nouveau les aventures de Jade.



Sinon pour les deux du fond, ce jeu est une perle, vous pouvez l'acheter les yeux fermés !

18566569.review:
[h1] Gameplay [/h1]

Beyond good and evil is a openworld rpg.
The combat is quite simple you have 1 attack button ( and upgrades later on ) and a dodge button.
Overtime you get upgrades like gloves that shoot things.
And heres comes my favorite bit the camera you take pictures of creatures/npcs to gain money and pearls.
Pearls are used for upgrades for your vehicles you gain em by doing races, exploring, making enough photos, and lastly bosses.
You have activities like racing just cave with creatures and pearls etc.
You travel through the world with your boat and aircraft(which you get pretty late)
The ship controls are pretty good and the combat is also solid, But then theres the aircraft controls which arent as good i suggest you just hold space while using the mouse.
You have followers if they die game over, oh and they do special attacks.
And as last you have stealth guard have 3 modes : the they havent seen you yet mode( green), The they heard you or saw you a lil bit (pink?), and the theyve seen you hide or kill em now( red).
Most stealth rooms i just killed the guards they all mostly have a weak spot at theyre backs, but some rooms you have to stealth or youll get instakilled.
The bosses are pretty easy once you find out what to hit or with what to hit the bosses.
The last boss however can stunlock you and it inverts your controls,  i just gave up on the boss because i couldnt do it.


[h1] Story [/h1]

I really dont want to spoil anything but ill just tell about some of the characters.
You play as jade and you have peyj as your companion. i really cared abut the characters.
Then you have the alpha somethings theyre here to save the hillyans and then there are the domz which are the evil aliens.
The story is really well paced and you really have some feels moments in it.


[h1] Audio and graphics [/h1]
The soundtrack is amazing it does the creepy music right the intense music/action music really gives you a boost.
The graphics havent aged that well but the creature designs are great, the npcs are either just normal humans or just humans crossed with animals,
The other creatures looks also quite reminiscent of various animals.
The town looks futuristic.
Oh and if you have the flickery graphics bug go to yer setting launcher and turn off hw something processing.
The camera sometimes has siezures but its ok somtimes ihad to fight with the damn thing.

[h1] Final verdict [/h1]
Amzazing soundtrack story which you care about the characters, pretty basic combat,
stealth which mostly just works but you can combat out of most rooms.
Dated but good artstyle/npc’s.
But a bad last boss.
And a refreshing camera mechanic.


[i]No drama, [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/justreviews]Just Reviews.[/url][/i]

18513820.review:
Ahh, conocida por muchos en su tiempo como la hermana pequeña de Lara Croft; Jade, la protagonista de este fantástico y atrapante juego es una aficionada a la fotografía quien lleva una vida como protectora de niños huérfanos en un faro ubicado en un lejano planeta que se encuentra bajo la constante amenaza de fuerzas alienígenas, poco a poco se vera inmersa en una peligrosa investigación para desvelar un entramado complot por tomar el control de todo el planeta.

Beyond Good and Evil es un juego que si bien es algo viejo aun puede ofrecer para quienes quieran apostar por el, una fascinante historia, niveles con diseños hermosos y un soundtrack envolvente. Fue considerado por muchos en su tiempo como toda una joya y aun hoy lo sigue siendo.
Su jugabilidad es muy fluida, el sistema de combate se adapta muy bien a los controles y en cuanto a su rendimiento en pc; la verdad es que no exige muchos recursos, todo esto sin dejar de lado que para ser un juego de la época goza de excelentes gráficos y detalles muy bien cuidados.

Pros:
- Fluida jugabilidad
- Excelente historia
- Control bastante cómodo
- Durabilidad
- Poca exigencia de recursos (buenas noticias para pc de baja gama)

Contras:
- Algunos problemas de texturas, pero no es nada que no se pueda solucionar echando un vistazo en el foro (nada grave)

18497737.review:
Credo che Beyond Good and Evil sia il videogioco più sottovalutato della storia. Lo credo sinceramente, perché quando uscì, nel 2003, non se lo filò praticamente nessuno: piacque molto alla stampa specialistica, che lo premiò con un fottio di valutazioni molto positive, ma il pubblico languiva. Prova ne sia che, quando lo comprai io, circa un anno dopo, era venduto a 15 euro.
E un prezzo così basso mi portò a chiedermi “Perché costa così poco?”. Avevo quattordici anni ed ero decisamente molto più ingenuo di quanto non lo sia adesso, ma mi bastò aprire la scatola, inserire il disco nell’Xbox e giocarci per un paio d’ore per pormi di nuovo la stessa domanda.
Perché costa così poco?
Nel 2004, quando ci giocai io, Beyond Good and Evil era semplicemente un capolavoro, ma forse anche una sorta di canto del cigno. Due anni prima della sua uscita era successo qualcosa: Bungie aveva dimostrato non solo che gli FPS su console erano possibili, ma che potevano anche essere bei giochi. Nonostante avesse il sottotitolo più idiota della storia (e sfido chiunque a dire che Combat Evolved è un buon sottotitolo), Halo si rivelò essere un successo e anche un gioco tremendamente figo. Purtroppo, però, finì anche con l’inaugurare una nuova epoca nei videogiochi per console e qualcuno, per forza di cose, doveva pagarne le conseguenze.
Prima di allora si può dire, semplificando un po’, che se si voleva giocare a un bell’action-adventure si optava per le console, mentre se si voleva giocare a un FPS si optava per i PC. Si tratta ovviamente di una grossissima semplificazione, soprattutto considerando che, per esempio, la PS1 aveva il monopolio dei simulatori di corse, mentre i giochi di corse arcade erano distribuiti più uniformemente tra le diverse piattaforme, ma è indiscutibile che l’action-adventure (all’epoca li chiamavamo “azione-avventura”, a onor del vero) è un genere che nasce e muore su console, mentre lo sparatutto nasce su PC e solo dopo il 2001 tende a spostarsi su console.
Si può considerare Halo una rivoluzione nel campo delle console? Certo che sì. E chiunque sa che ogni rivoluzione miete necessariamente le sue vittime innocenti o, detto con molta meno diplomazia, che non si può fare una frittata senza rompere qualche uovo. Il genere action-adventure è stato la vittima della rivoluzione innescata da Halo. Il che è ancora più triste considerato che considero la serie di Halo una delle migliori di tutti i tempi.
Questo pippone storico serve a far capire in che contesto uscì Beyond Good and Evil, un periodo di svolta in cui, tra le altre cose, i fan degli action-adventure erano stati recentemente delusi (per usare un eufemismo) da quella specie di aborto che è Tomb Raider: the Angel of Darkness e che probabilmente avranno pensato due volte prima di acquistare un titolo uscito quasi dal nulla come BGaE.
Ma mettiamo da parte le considerazioni sul periodo storico e consideriamo il gioco per quello che è. Beyond Good and Evil non è un open world, anche se fa un ottimo lavoro per cercare di convincerti del contrario. Piuttosto, il gioco è strutturato intorno a un hub centrale (il pianeta Hillys, che stranamente non è un grande produttore di caffè) in cui il giocatore è libero di spostarsi tramite hovercraft e da cui può accedere ai vari livelli, che è possibile rivisitare anche dopo il completamento per accedere ad aree prima inaccessibili (per esempio, perché non si possedeva ancora l’abilità necessaria per raggiungerla) o completare uno dei due minigame presenti nel gioco. L’impressione che se ne ricava è molto simile a quella di un open world, anche se concettualmente somiglia di più al sistema usato in alcuni giochi a piattaforme, come Spyro 2 e 3.
Protagonista del gioco è Jade, una giovane fotoreporter che, assieme a suo zio adottivo Pey’j, un maiale antropomorfo, gestisce un orfanotrofio in cui accoglie i figli delle persone rapite dai Domz, una razza aliena contro cui Hillys è in guerra. Da qui, la trama si infittisce di intrighi e assume toni anche vagamente complottistici. Senza spoilerare niente, diciamo solo che non tutto è ciò che sembra e non tutti i cittadini di Hillys sembrano essere limpidi. In una frase brevissima: è una figata. Certo, non è tutto oro ciò che luccica e alcuni aspetti della trama potevano essere migliorati. Per esempio, quel. Cazzo. Di. Finale. Giuro, il cliffhanger finale mi ha fatto incazzare e continua a farmi incazzare a tutt’oggi. Non termini un videogioco, un film o un romanzo con un cliffhanger se non sei più che sicuro che questo verrà sviluppato in un seguito. E quel seguito, a distanza di 12 anni, non ne vuole sapere di arrivare, e probabilmente non arriverà mai, anche se questo gioco merita non dico una conclusione, ma almeno una continuazione, perché Beyond Good and Evil ha molti punti di forza dalla sua.
Oltre alla già citata trama, di per sé solida, anche se molto semplice e lineare, il level design è fantastico, decisamente ispirato ed è un enorme piacere esplorare ogni piccolo recesso del mondo per fotografare tutti gli animali o raccogliere tutte e 88 le perle disseminate nelle varie ambientazioni, complice anche un’eccellente colonna sonora. Ognuna di queste è abbastanza diversa dalle altre, anche se tutti i livelli sono ambientati prevalentemente in luoghi chiusi e angusti in cui il giocatore dovrà imparare ad aggirare i nemici, vuoi perché sono in troppi, vuoi perché sono presenti delle torrette che, quando agganciano Jade, la uccidono istantaneamente. Come si suol dire: “Instant death is always fun!”. Per fortuna nessun ostacolo è insormontabile e con un po’ di pazienza è possibile superare anche le sezioni più difficili. Sfortunatamente, il sistema dei checkpoint non è esattamente perfetto e il non poter saltare i filmati non aiuta: a volte può capitare di dover guardare lo stesso filmato due o tre volte dopo essersele fatte suonare. Ma nemmeno questo è un enorme problema. Il problema veramente grande è il sistema di salvataggio, che richiede l’uso di appositi terminali. Non si può dire che nel 2015 questo sistema sia esattamente conveniente.
Eppure, Beyond Good and Evil è ancora perfettamente giocabile, nonostante i dodici anni passati dalla sua uscita. Certo, la versione Steam (e anche quella GOG, se è per questo) non è il remake HD, ma lo stile grafico è ancora godibile. Certo, il sistema di controlli è chiaramente preso pezzo per pezzo da quello delle console. Certo, eseguendolo su sistemi moderni sono presenti diversi glitch grafici. Eppure, questo gioco è comunque un piccolo capolavoro che in molti, in troppi hanno sottovalutato. E merita disperatamente un seguito.
Ubisoft, so che tra noi due in passato ci sono state divergenze. Sono perfettamente consapevole che tu, come tutte le altre aziende, puoi fare scelte del cazzo (tipo non assumermi, per esempio), ma so benissimo che sei in grado, quando vuoi, di fare anche dei giochi fantastici. Quindi, smetti di cazzeggiare con i vari Assassin’s Creed e fai un favore a tutti i tuoi fan: continua questa storia. Credo che noi giocatori ce lo meritiamo.

18492079.review:
Story first, i got this game around 2003-04 when i was just a simple kid with no english language skills. Only things i understood about this game was:

#1. Hit evil aliens in the face
#2. Pig man is your friend.
#3. Take photos of animals and things
#4. Go around in a hovercraft.. somewhere.

Back then, i only visited the Hillys City and never went forward from there. I played it maybe a couple of days, then, i forgot the game for a long time. At times i heard and saw something about the game, the upcoming sequal etc. But never i decided to playthrough it, even though i was always intrigued about it.

UNTIL NOW. I saw Beyond Good & Evil in steam sale under 2 euros. There, in that moment,
i decided finally to play it through. Better late than never, right?

And oh man yes, i did the right choice.

The interesting semi-open world, diverse characters which you actually start to care about. 
Unique art style, awesome soundtrack as well great sound desing overall.
Fun engaging and unique gameplay mechanics and the gripping, touching, even shocking story makes this game truly a masterpiece.

PS: To make Beyond Good & Evil work in modern PC's properly, remember to DISABLE these settings in the Advanced Settings tab in the games launcher/SettingsApplication.exe:
- HW Vertex Processing
- Multi vertex stream
- Autogen mipmap

This is how you get rid of the annoying flickering stuff.

I also recommend this Widescreen Fix:
 http://community.pcgamingwiki.com/files/file/22-beyond-good-evil-widescreen-fix/
Like it says, "Extract the files to the same folder as BGE.exe and edit the included .ini file to achieve your desired resolution. Don't forget to set the game's resolution to the same values as you did in the .ini, failing to do so will result in resolution glitches in most cases."

For more help, visit http://pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Beyond_Good_%26_Evil

17950988.review:
[u][b]-Quick Review-[/b][/u]
Beyond Good and Evil is Ubisoft's under-rated-masterpiece, it was first released on the PlayStation 2 on November 11, 2003. The beautiful Music was Composed by Christophe Héral.
Beyond Good and Evil is by far the most beautiful, outstanding game I ever played on the PS2, and when I saw it was available on Steam I exploded. There are many games that we as gamers 'play and forget'. Beyond Good and Evil is one of the games I will never forget.


[u][b]-Video Review!-[/b][/u]
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wo3HgK_4kcQ


[u][b]-Detailed breakdown review-[/b][/u]
[b]Story:[/b] Beyond Good and Evil's Protagonist is a bright young woman named Jade. Jade is an avid martial artist, photographer and investigative reporter. She has been staying with her 'Uncle' Pay'j [i](A pig/boar-like biped, whom is acting as Jade's Guardian)[/i] to help take care of orphans at their lighthouse home.
Jade and Pay'j are on the mining planet “Hillys”. Hillys is under siege by an extraterrestrial group known as the “DomZ”, the DomZ are skeleton-reaper-like-aliens whom abduct and drain the life from their victims. Recently a group known as “The Alpha Sections” have taken up residence on Hillys. The Alpha Sections have sworn to defend the population of Hillys from these devastating DomZ attacks.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=511832142

[b]Gameplay:[/b] You play the game as Jade, in a third person camera view, the game is broken down into two modes: combat mode and stealth mode. [i](Side note: There is much more to the game than that, sometimes you need to take pictures, solve puzzles, figure out riddles, play mini games, and have dialogue with other NPC's.)[/i]
When in combat, Jade wields a special Bo Staff known as a “Jō”; Jade preforms strikes, flips, and power attacks while in combat mode. If you were unsuccessful in sneaking past enemies you can fight your way through many parts of the game. However there is definitely an emphasis on stealth rather than fighting.
When in stealth, Jade sneaks and rolls, there are oftentimes alternative paths to sneak around guards, other times you need to distract guards by creating a diversion to take them away from their posts, while you sneak past.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=511832150

[i]A final note I should make, is the console to PC port wasn't quite perfect; the camera angle is sometimes a little bit awkward, but you eventually get used to the limitations and controls; Beyond Good and Evil is still very playable.[/i]

[b]Achievements:[/b] There are no achievements in the game, however there are extra things to collect while playing. You can take pictures of all the animals in the game, and collect all the pearls, and find every M-disks. 

[b]Price:[/b] Beyond Good and Evil is priced at $9.99, my first play through I unlocked everything before beating the game [i](I took my sweet time about it, and it took about 9-11 hours)[/i] the game can easily take anywhere from 6-8 hours to complete.

When I was younger playing this game on the PS2; I remember that I almost beat this whole game in a day. My parrents left the house in the late morning and I started playing Beyond Good and Evil, when they got back that evening I was still playing. Needless to say, they were not pleased with my binge-playing-habits.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=511832156

[b]Conclusion:[/b] Seriously, just buy and play this game.

------Edits and updates------
Edit/Update August 29, 2015:
Spelling fix, by Angfucious. [i](Then, Than, Thyn, QQthen -the q's are silent)[i]
Edit/Update January 31, 2016:
Added link to YouTube Review for Beyond Good and Evil

17944442.review:
Beyond Good and Evil is hands down, an all-time favorite game from my childhood. What immediately grabbed my attention was the art-style and the music. Even after finishing the game multiple times, I often find myself listening to the soundtrack.

The characters in the game are wonderfully done (in my opinion), including the two companions whom join you on your mission. A bonus was that I never had to run around looking for them, only to find them stuck on an obstacle or anything like that. Even while progressing, collecting all of the pearls and playing the mini-games are fun distractions too.

I did have a few issues with glitchy textures and whatnot, but the forums quickly fixed the issue and I was able to play it within a few minutes. The only thing I'll half heartedly complain about is the semi-wonky camera. It can be a bit annoying to maintain in the Beluga, and I had it get stuck once or twice. The few times the camera got stuck on walls, I was easily able to fix it without having to restart the game or losing any progress. As for the vehicle; I doubt it'll work for everyone, but I stopped having issues with it while driving if I didn't move the camera with my mouse.

Something I'm saddened by is how little commercial success this game received. That, and the fact that apparently this was the first installment in what was supposed to be a trilogy. The sequel was originally revealed in 2008, had a video leaked in 2009, and was announced to still be in development in 2011 and 2012. Interestingly, a poster of Beyond Good and Evil 2 concept art of Jade was shown in 2013. I'm unsure if anything else has been announced, leaked, or otherwise, but I personally still have my fingers crossed for the sequel.

Beyond Good and Evil est une expérience unique ! Il est vrai que j'étais assez sceptique en le prenant, mais une fois que nous sommes dans l'aventure, quel plaisir d'arpenter la planète d'Hillys avec Jade et son oncle Pey'j !! De l'action, de la plate-forme et des courses viennent ponctuer l'histoire ! Le système de combat est assez rudimentaire, mais fonctionne bien ! Les musiques sont très bonnes, et les missions proposées sont assez variées pour que l'on ait pas l'impression de faire tout le temps la même chose. 

De l'action, des courses en hovercraft, des phases en vaisseau, de l'infiltration, des quêtes annexes très intéréssantes (je vous laisse le soin de les découvrir), un open-world très bien maîtrisé avec des personnages charismatiques, etc ! Un jeu parfait, mais quelques bémoles viennent ternir le tableau...

Des bandes noirs qui mangent un tiers l'écran (impossible à enlever), un jeu trop court (on en veut plus !!), une fin baclée et... Il n'y a pas de suite alors que de nombreuses questions restent en suspant !

Malgré ça, BGE reste un classique du jeu vidéo ;-)

17474024.review:
Beyond Good and Evil is a 2003 Stealth Action-Adventure game developed by Ubisoft Montpellier, the studio behind the Rayman series and also responsible for original titles like From Dust. Montpellier, as a creative powerhouse, delivered Beyond Good and Evil to critical acclaim, but devastatingly poor sales have infamously seen the sequel perpetually delayed.

This is a horrible port, and you should not buy it. 

Beyond Good and Evil is not a perfect game. This is the only version of it I've played, so my experience is not all encompassing. However, I felt that most, if not all, of the problem with the game stemmed from what a horrendous port this is. 

It controls absolutely awful, because for a game that is designed solely for gamepads, it dictates that you use the keyboard and mouse. Trying to steer Jade while clicking away in haphazard combos isn't fun at all, along with common mishaps like sticking to walls and desperately waggling the mouse in radial-based menus like an idiot. 

There is no gamepad support for this game whatsoever, outside of using a clunky 3rd-party program like Xpadder. So that means when the game restricts you camera to a 2D plane, you just have to deal with it. When it decides to wrench your camera away for you for no apparent reason, you just have to deal with it. When you're desperately wrenching the mouse while janking the hovercraft with the WASD keys to get it around corners, you just have to deal with it.

Those are just the control issues. Even after disabling a certain amount of options to get the game running at above a powerpoint rate (note: simply lowering the settings made the game perform even worse) I had constant plummets in framerate and constant graphical glitches. This port (not by Montpellier) makes Ubisoft's recent debacles look good.

It is, however, a decent game. The gameplay is shallow, and the amount of distractions in the disappointingly small hub-world one-note, but the game is carried by the amazing art style and music. The art style speaks for itself, and the music is worth tracking down if you can. While not sold on the game's cult classic status, the game is a solid casual Action Adventure that doesn't demand much in the way of attention and delivers on the premise plenty. 

I'm not recommending this, not because you shouldn't play this, but because you shouldn't play this version. Play the HD version, emulate a console version, by Jove even dig out a sixth gen system and track down a physical copy if you're truly dedicated to playing this game and seeing what the hype is all about.

Playing the Steam version of Beyond Good and Evil will only sour you on an already hard to sell game.

17031925.review:
[i]„Foťák, hůl a odvahu.“[/i]

Tato hra z roku 2003, vznikla ve studiu Ubisoft Montpellier, které stojí i za kousky jako [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/33460/]From Dust[/url] nebo [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/260230/]Valiant Hearts: The Great War[/url]. Na starosti ji zde měl Michel Ancel, „otec“ [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/207490/]Raymana[/url], takže vás asi nepřekvapí, že má hra velice odlehčenou atmosféru. Samotný úvod, ovšem působí skoro až katastrofickým dojmem.

Planeta Hillys bývala mírumilovným místem, oplývající radostí a životem, to už ale dávno neplatí. Již mnoho let, musí čelit pravidelným nájezdům mimozemské rasy, zvané DomZ. I přes neutuchající snahu, vládních ozbrojených jednotek Alpha Sections, se těmto výpadům nedaří zabránit. Pro děti, které při útoku přišly o rodiče, byl proto vybudován nový domov v útulném majáku. Pečuje tu o ně fotografka Jade a její strýček Pey'j, který je sice velké prase, ale má srdce na správném místě. Jednoho dne, dostane Jade zprávu od tajemného pana De Castellaca. Sama ještě netuší, o jak důležitý moment se jedná...

Příběh není špatný, ale neočekávejte nic komplikovaného, jedná se o klasický souboj dobra se zlem. Je navíc podán velmi přímočaře, takže se toho o světě a postavách moc nedozvíte, ale zase to hezky odsýpá a „pořád se něco děje“. Hra poskytuje překvapivě dost volnosti, kdy můžete se svým vznášedlem prozkoumávat celou herní plochu. Ta sice není moc rozlehlá, ale je na ní ukryto mnoho vedlejších úkolů, nabízejících především vzácné perly, potřebné pro další postup ve hře. Odměnu dostáváte také za fotografování místní fauny, což je často velice zábavné a napínavé (Stihnete zmáčknout spoušť dřív, než vás to kousne?).

V příběhových misích, pak budete hlavně řešit prostorové hádanky, bojovat s nepřáteli a plížit se. Hádanky jsou celkem snadné a logické, takže vám jejich řešení zabere maximálně pár minut. Potyčky s protivníky, také nepředstavují žádnou velkou výzvu, protože soubojový systém je velmi zjednodušený. Co se ovšem moc nepovedlo, je kradmý pohyb a kličkování mezi strážemi. V těchto chvílích, se totiž kamera chová dost zmateně a nepředvídatelně, což je místy celkem frustrující. Vynikající je naopak grafická stylizace, díky které vypadá hra dobře i po tolika letech. Za zmínku stojí též povedený hudební doprovod, protože něco tak pestrého, jinde neuslyšíte.

Pokud si tedy chcete zahrát povedenou hru, plnou dobrodružství a odlehčené atmosféry, pak máte mé doporučení.

PS: Jestli vám budou problikávat textury, pak řešení tohoto problému naleznete [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=121217154]ZDE[/url].

[i][url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/6861342/]Další recenze na mé kurátorské stránce[/url][/i]

16571118.review:
It's hard to say who this game was meant for. It looks rather kiddy at first, but deals with some dark themes and plotlines, and also is rather frustratingly difficult at times. In many ways the definition of an award-winning flop, it's got a quirky style to it that you may or may not be on board with. Gameplay consists of platforming (which is solid), combat (which is bland), stealth (which is fun but frustrating), and driving/shooting (which is unpleasant). Nothing in the gameplay really stands out as exceptional, but the world and story are well-realized, even if the plot is sometimes overdramatic. 

Flawed, but charming and memorable. It's goofy and creative in its best moments, awkward and sloppy at its worst. There's a lot to like and enjoy, but plenty of moments that left me scratching my head. Difficulty was all over the place, with tricky parts not helped by the camera, but most of it was on the easier side. Despite what it has going against it, the quirkiness and setting were more than enough to drive my curiosity to the ending. 

I experienced some minor technical issues on windows 8.1, mostly just flickering textures, and a crash or two, but I didn't consider them enough of a bother to stop me from playing. Your experience may vary, as this is known to be somewhat unstable on newer OS's.

16440058.review:
This was one of my favorite games on the X-box (if not my favorite), and is currently still my top 3 of best games all time. It's just one of those golden oldies where the story, the feel and the gameplay are more important than having the latest shiney graphics (but boring repetative gameplay and zero depth). I bought this to relive the adventure (and to kill time waiting for part 2 ;)), and for the current price on sale I can only recommend everyone to do the same.

You take on the role of reporter Jade and her trusted pig buddy Pey'J, who must fight to uncover a conspiracy of global proportions taking place on their homeplanet Hyllis. The game sports RPG-like elements, since Jade has equipement that can be upgraded by collecting a special currency, blue pearls, which are collected by defeating enemies and minigames. Although the storyline is linear, (parts of) the world can be roamed freely in between missions, giving a great sense of freedom. Most of the characters you encounter while roaming are likeable and often funny. All-in-all the game is strong all-round, offering excelling storytelling and gameplay, and fitting graphics and music.

[b]Why buy it?[/b]
[list]
[*]Loveable protagonists
[*]Fantastic atmosphere
[*]Great storytelling
[*]Diverse gameplay - fast combat with fun puzzles and minigames
[*]Wonderful music and sound effects
[*]Personally, I also really enjoy the cartoony, colourful graphics style
[/list]

[b]Why not?[/b]
[list]
[*]It is a port from the X-box (classic), and a somewhat poor one: some people are having problems setting the game up properly, and are having some difficulties with the controls
[*]It's (13 years!) old, so you might find the graphics a bit outdated
[/list]

16064217.review:
Beyond Good and Evil. Bei mir kommen da Erinnerungen an meine Kindheit hoch. Ein superschönes Spiel, gespielt auf einem uralten Computer, was dazu führte, dass das Video etwa zehnmal langsamer lief als der Ton - aber das war es trotzdem wert.

Warum sollte man diesen alten Schinken (harhar) rauskramen und spielen?
1) Eine absolut liebevoll gestaltete Spielwelt, mit ebenso liebevoll gestalteten Charakteren.
2) Eine hübsche Grafik. Viele der 2000er-Spiele fallen in die Kategorie "Augenkrebs", dieses jedoch ganz sicher nicht.
3) Eine STORY. Und eine gute noch oben drein.
4) Eine weibliche Hauptfigur.
5) Gutes Gameplay mit vielen Facetten: Kämpfe, Schleicheinlagen, Hovercraftrennen, Minispiele... Aber am wichtigsten wird immer die Kamera sein.

Wahrscheinlich fallen mir nach dem Abschicken noch mehr Gründe ein.

Was vor dem Kauf WICHTIG ist: Man sollte sich dessen bewusst sein, dass es zu Komplikationen zwischen Spiel und Computer/Laptop kommen kann. Zum Beispiel ist das Spiel nicht darauf ausgelegt, auf einem Gerät mit zwei Prozessoren zu laufen (DualCore und so Geschichten), was dazu führt, dass das Video davongaloppiert, während der Sound hinterherhinkt. In meinem Fall geholfen hat a) die "full processing.exe" (in einem Forum gefunden, einfach mal nachgoogeln) und b) Einstellungen des Spiels in "SettingsApplication.exe" anzupassen. Welche genau umgestellt werden müssen, kann man auch den Foren entnehmen.

Wer bereit ist, sich auf eine wilde Rauferei mit seinem PC oder Lappi einzulassen, dem sei von vornherein dazu gratuliert, dass er 4,99€ absolut richtig und in ein wunderbares Spiel investiert :-)

Каждый новый хиллийский рассвет, каждого сиротку с маяка, каждую зверушку - да даже ворчливого Руфуса! А с учетом того, что все это великолепие дополняется непередаваемой красоты саундтреком, игра если не влюбляет в себя, то как минимум напрашивается на несколько добрых слов.
Следующий пункт - богатый игровой мир. Хиллия - планета небольшая (по крайней мере, доступная нам часть), поэтому здесь нам предоставляется обширная свобода действий. В любое время можно пойти пропустить партейку палочек в "Акуде", сюжетная миссия подождет. Проникнуться игровым миром так же помогает наша побочная миссия длительностью практически во всю игру: фотоохота за зверушками. Если вы - исправный фотограф, то вам придется исследовать каждый уголок Хиллии. Вы не пожалеете.
Что касается непосредственно сюжета и вообще хода игры: тут, в общем-то, все предельно просто. Вот вам сильная героиня самых честных правил, вот вам государственный заговор, вот вам фотоаппарат - вперед, за правдой! Игра не будет подкидывать неприятных сюрпризов и неразрешимых головоломок, над которыми нужно биться часами, механизмы поиска путей везде схожи, надо только умело пользоваться ими. Даже победа над главным боссом займет не больше пары минут, если просчитать нужный для успеха алгоритм и успевать хватать перекусы. 
По-хорошему, с [b]BGE[/b] справится даже ребенок, но это не идет ей в минус. Игра очень приятная, добрая и даже милая - прекрасный образец своего времени. К сожалению, лишь немногая часть аудитории признала эту красоту, и мне за свою любимицу до сих пор очень обидно. Что я могу сказать: только самые проникновенные искатели разглядели жемчужину в песчинке. Я буду любоваться закатами Хиллии и ждать сиквела, а вы найдите времечко и поиграйте - не пожалеете.

15694627.review:
The good: 

-The art direction and diverse cast of characters
-Photojournalism is the main weapon of your protagonist, and seeing it used as a concept in a fantasy setting is really refreshing
-The protagonists. Without spoiling anything, Jade and Pey'j are a memorable duo, heartwarming characters in general, and there's still plenty of mystery surrounding them. Jade and Double H were a fun team as well, and there seems to be a lot of untold depth to even the minor characters, namely anyone found in the Akuda Bar
-The soundtrack 

The bad:

-The camera is sometimes wonky, especially on the PC
-It's kind of an extension of the camera problem, but controlling the game's two vehicles can be frustrating in some parts
-A little short, could have been one level/mission longer imo, but that's because I really enjoyed what I got

The ugly: 

-The fact that this game was a commercial failure, isn't well known even to this day, and its sequel has been in development hell but is well deserving of existing already

Conclusion: Play this game. It's charming, unique, and refreshing despite being over a decade old.

15457521.review:
Beyond Good and Evil is one of the most beautiful, amazing and original games the humanity has ever seen. (I really like it)
Thanks to it's particular and charming design the game has aged like fine wine(*). While it was released in 2003 it has nothing to envy to current indies or more "aesthetic" games. It drives one of the most amazing an beautifully written stories I've ever seen, it's an amazing and original open world adventure game that will keep you hooked for many hours.

*While the games is amazing, the port is old and it's engine doesn't play too well in post Windows XP machines without some tweaking. Gladly, we can fix that, when you launch the game, you will be presented with a Settings window (you can find the settings executable in your Steam libradry folder \steamapps\common\Beyond Good and Evil\SettingsApplication.exe), go to Advance Settings and in the Compability menu check "Manual Compatibily Settings" so you can manage the rest of the settings and uncheck the following options:
[list]
[*] Triple-buffering
[*] HW Vertex Processing
[*] Multi vertex stream
[*] W Buffer
[/list]

If you are still having issues, check [url=http://pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Beyond_Good_and_Evil]the PC Gaming Wiki page for Beyond Good and Evil[/url] or some of the [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=121217154] Steam Community Guides or Discussions about the game[/url]

15455938.review:
Beyond Good & Evil è uno dei migliori giochi prodotti da Ubisoft Montpellier, frutto del geniale Michel Ancel e del suo team!

Questo gioco ha un gameplay che fonde il genere RPG con l'ACTION. Le quest impegnative non mancano, alternate con combattimenti rapidi e accattivanti. I personaggi sono forti, passionali e indimenticabili, come la protagonista Jade e inoltre la direzione artistica è originalissima. La trama non è solo interessante, bensì dona emozioni e sorrisi al giocatore, tanto da spingerlo a proseguire la storia fino alla fine. Il gioco si presenta con una grafica gradevole per i tempi (2003) ed è accompagnato da una splendida colonna sonora, azzeccata per ogni situazione di gioco. Mi dispiace giusto per alcuni glitch grafici dell' HUD dovuti al porting per PC, ma sono decisamente passabili. Personalmente, non vedo l'ora che il seguito di questo gioco, Beyond Good & Evil 2, in produzione sempre dalla Ubisoft Montpellier e diretto da Michel Ancel, venga pubblicato presto!

Consiglio e riconsiglio sempre questo capolavoro!

En plus d'être parfaitement agréable à jouer, le jeu se paye le luxe de vous lacher dans un monde ouvert en vous laissant la possibilité d'aller ou bon vous semble. Le jeu ne resemble à rien de connu et une fois terminé, on en veux encore.

Si on ne devait lui trouvé qu'un défaut c'est clairement que la caméra semble avoir été codé par un stagiaire... qui avait dut se trompé de porte le jour de l'entretient d'embauche.

A mettre entre toute les mains

14293821.review:
This is a really good game! I've played it on PS2, Gamecube and pc and now again on pc.
Do not mind the driver update thingy you get on startup, if you have the most recent Steam client it will work fine.

The game is a bit easy on pc compared to the consoles because it is easy to spam and aim. When you get into the first fight you'll notice.

Another thing, there are pearls in this game and one of them can be obtained through playing a minigame of airhockey (something like that). This one can be really tricky, unless you know the "trick", it is in the game intentionally so no glitch or whatever.

First of all you should make every shot count. But here is what a lot of people do not know, you can hold LMB for longer to give the pugs(?) more momentum. The walrus(?) you play against does this as well, that is why it sometimes feels like his pugs weigh 10 times more than yours. So if there are 3 pugs in the middle area, hold down LMB for as long as you can to knock 'em all back onto his side.

Another thing, save the game before attempting to do it. When you lose you can just load the save game and try again. This will prevent you from losing all your currency.

Hope this helps!

13988245.review:
Dopo 10 anni...

...finalmente dopo 10 anni sono riuscito a ritrovare, rigiocare e finalmente finire questo gioco.
Per l'epoca in cui è uscito secondo me aveva ottime caratteristiche (alcune anche ora).

Certo, il livello di difficoltà è tarato sul basso, tanto che mi sono stupito di come trovassi difficile da piccolo superare un determianto livello, ma passato questo secondo me siamo davanti ad un ottimo gioco, con una personalità sua (ovviamente tenendo presente negli anni in cui è uscito che oggi verrebbe definito un po' povero di background).

Ci sono alcuni glitch grafici ma che (almeno a me con windows 8) sono riuscito a togliere disattivando l'anti aliasing,  il sistema di comandi solo su tastiera all'inizio fa rabbrividire, ma fortunatamente la difficoltà non elevata del gioco fa si che ci si abitui presto.

Una delle cose chi mi ha più stupito è stata la colonna sonora, la canzoncina idiota del Mammago, quella strana del bar Akuda, quella epica contro i Domz e quella frenetica delle corse di hovercraft.
Sono tutte musiche e canzoni che funzionano, che ti fanno coinvolgere e immergere di più nello strano mondo di Beyond good and evil.

L'unica cosa che mi ha davvero fatto irritare è stato il boss finale, in una parte del combattimento pare che si siano scordati di settare un tempo di pausa tra un'attacco e l'altro, tanto che con un colpo finivo a terra, appena rialzato mi riattaccava senza che io potessi fare nulla e finivo nuovamente a terra.

Ora... finendo il gioco e sapendo che è (o era) in progetto il 2 mi sono incuriosito, che un sequel fatto bene mi avrebbe fatto piacere, poi vengo a scoprire che questo gioco è edito da ubisoft.
Sapendo le politiche "ubisoftiane" attuali, il modo in cui fanno i giochi con scadenze ridicole per gli sviluppatori e infarciti di dlc e altro, mi duole ammetterlo ma spero che non facciano il 2, almeno finché non si rimettono a fare giochi come si deve.

13978201.review:
Obviously surprising to most readers of this review, I didn't like the game. Please read all of it before bashing it though. It seems like everybody and their mother claims this game to be one of the best and beg for a sequel. I disagree. I only finished the game for the first time, never played it before. Maybe if I played it when younger I'd have some nostalgic factor or something, but that wouldn't actually mean the game is good... because the game is just not that good.

The game, first off, is really, really simple, which isn't something I mean negatively. There's many simple modern games I enjoy, like Fable, so that isn't a bad point. The problem is that all of the simple "pieces" don't really work as expected. Before getting into the game, just a quick brush on graphics and such, though those don't really sway my opinion of a game. The graphics weren't bad, rough in places, but overall pretty decent for years back. The sound, on the other hand, was only okay. People seem to love the soundtrack, but all in all it was pretty average and had nothing exciting.

The only song that stood out to me was out on the sea early in the game, the peaceful one reused at the beginning of the credits. It was really nice and I loved that one. Besides songs, the dialogue was decent. Audio sync didn't really cause many problems for me, only once or twice.

Now, onto the game. The characters were all lackluster. I didn't really care about any of them, even the kids. The only one I liked was Pey'j. Jade didn't really stand out as a special protagonist, though I did feel a little twinge at a couple places near the end (mostly due to Pey'j). The kids were really only used at the beginning and end... and the same goes for Secundo. And Double H was sooooooo annoying. I really, really hated him. His voice and style was the most generically annoying possible.

When it came to the NPCs in terms of gameplay, it was a waste. They served virtually no purpose other than to move around a couple puzzles and to bash their special ability during combat. But they served to make combat more annoying. They just stood around, got attacked, and got pinned to the ground. I wanted to give them PA-1's, but I needed the health usually! Friendly fire made it worse, because they just stood in my way and often I would take off half a heart because they'd get hit.

Boss fights weren't good except for the final two bosses. All of the others were so simple and easy that I beat them all in less than 90 seconds each, some even less than 1 minute, because most of them were usually bashing the same pattern without thought. The first boss you could even beat without being touched, and without any effort.

The controls in the game were pretty wobbly, usually because of the camera, which would bounce around. In most of the levels, the confines were relatively cramped, so the camera bounced all over for me. I'd be seeing through walls or the ground, and could barely keep things focused. If you walk near certain walls, the camera would jump 180 degrees, so during combat, it was even more terrible. I'd often end up hitting random things or thin air.

Stealth wasn't that special. It was semi-enjoyable, but in some places the controls and camera made it worse. In one level (I think the Slaughterhouse? Or the one before it), there was sneaking through a foggy area, but it took me several tries to get through. It was really simple in idea, but my camera got stuck and I was always looking into the ground and at Zoey, all in the fog, so I could see nothing. It kept moving even if I centered the camera, so I could barely see the enemies. Other places were relatively annoying too, and all in all it just wasn't that fun or special.

The story was pretty generic, really. Oh no, people are betrayed and getting abducted by aliens? That's pretty much all it amounted to the entire game, except for the last 5 minutes. But because I lost interest by that point, the last 5 minutes of revealings didn't make me care any more or want a sequel. The aspect of using a camera as a special spy was interesting at first, but everything was generally repetitive, so nothing special.

Lastly, exploration was a bummer. I expected there to be a bit more to the world. I didn't expect something crazy... but there really wasn't much at all. The 4 races, meh. The 4 looter's caverns, meh. I mean, I did them all, and they were okay, but not much else opened up in the world as the game progressed. Only a couple more dungeon-like areas, but most were short.

And the biggest annoying part of that... the city. I really, really liked the looks of the city going into it at first. I expected it to open up more throughout the game and was excited about it. You get a city pass and I thought, finally! But you move like 50 more feet and hit another wall. So basically, for a decently-sized city, you get to explore none of it. They could have really made it bigger. A few alleys was really disappointing.

Anyway, everything culminated into a disappointment. I'm not complaining because of overhyping; I'm just stating that the game was generally flawed in almost all of its aspects. I have absolutely no desire to replay it, while there are many other games I have replayed or will replay through the years.

13603415.review:
I really wanted to enjoy Beyond Good and Evil. I'd only ever heard stellar reviews of the game. The cast of characters seemed interesting and dynamic. The game's art style appeared to have aged well. Even while playing it, I absolutely loved the soundtrack.

But the game falls apart mechanically. Maybe it's just because the game was originally designed for Xbox and Playstation, and the PC port didn't get the love it needed. Maybe it was the fact that I used a mouse and keyboard instead of a controller. Whatever the reason, the game really left me disappointed.

The stealth sections are clumsy, the camera is uncooperative and sometimes totally unresponsive, the combat is repetative, and the platforming sections are dull. Beyond Good and Evil feels like it's aspiring to be an action-adventure game the likes of Zelda, but it trips over itself and seems to miss the mark.

13280663.review:
I've wanted to play this game for a long time and this was the first time I've actually played through it. I really enjoyed it. The story, music, and world were a joy to experience and it's nice to play a game with the early aughts levity that you so seldom get in current games. 

Now, would I recommend this for the PC? ....Not necessarily, it is horribly ported. Every time I launched the game it said my graphics card drivers were out of date (they weren't) Apparently, if you run this on a newer machine, the game can't recognize your graphics card and will just pop that error up every time you launch. You can click through it to boot the game up, though. Before you do that, I would suggest going into the advanced settings (not ingame), going into the manual compatibility settings and disabling HW Vertex Processing: it's job is to bug your game out with random polygons and artifacts that make the game unplayable. From what I've read, this happens to a lot of people.

Another problem with the port, this game was designed for a controller, yet there's no controller support. If you're like me, you're going to need to faff about extensively with the control settings to get the game marginally comfortable to play. One thing that I couldn't fix was how both the mouse and WSAD keys sent the same commands when you're in a vehicle and it screws with the camera. All in all, while I got through the game fine enough, it felt like I was limping the whole way because of the poor controls.

The game itself, though, was wonderful. As I took in the music, characters, and setting of the game I was sad that this never got the trilogy it promised to be. It's got a little of everything in it, stealth, action, vehicles, mini-games, puzzles, NPC interaction; its really remarkable that all of this was in it way back in the early 2000's and I felt the experience actually aged quite well. The lightly cartoony look did the game well and avoided the "super realistic" games pitfal of looking and playing like ass now. It probably won't happen, but here's to hoping for that sequel to wrap things up!

12883407.review:
This game is absolutely magnificent. It's a puzzle-adventurer, very akin to The Legend of Zelda. A lot of the mechanics revolve around sneaking and not being detected. 

You take the role of a girl named Jade, living on a planet that's beginning to be overrun with aliens. She is hired as a reporter for a rogue organization to spy on the government, as many people think the government and the aliens are in cahoots. There are moments that'll make you cry and leave you on-edge. Jade is a great protagonist, and you'll come to love every character. The graphics are a little dated (the game was originally on PS2, GCN and Xbox, so the resolution is pretty bad and there are quite a few graphical glitches.) The game makes up for this though, with amazing soundtrack, great story and thrilling gameplay. You'll definitely feel like a spy playing this game!
I give this game a 9/10 (if it weren't for graphical glitches and sometimes monotonous battle system, it'd definitely get a 10/10)

12414026.review:
Inhaltlich ist es makellos. 
Die Story ist interessant und spannend, das Art Design ist stimmig, die Charaktere sind einzigartig, die Dialoge und Synchronisation sind gut gemacht und insgesamt ist das Gameplay wohl designt und sinnvoll proportioniert. Ich hab die PS2-Version schon oft gespielt (auch oft zu 100%) und würde es zu meinen Lieblingsspielen auf diesem System zählen.

ABER
...diese Portierung ist katastrophal. Überwiegend liegt es an der Steuerung, denn obwohl einst Programmierung für den XBox Controller angefertigt wurde, wird diese hier nicht verwendet. Dieses Problem löst weitere aus und ist ein Fass ohne Boden. Darüber hinaus spackt die Kamera teilweise unkontrolliert herum und verändert somit die Steuerung. Das macht vor allem die Hovercraft-Segmente annähernd unspielbar. Ich habe eine Reihe von unterschiedlichen technischen Problemen verzeichnet. Von Kartenabschnitten die grafisch nicht dargestellt werden, über Cutscenes, wo Bild und Ton nicht synchron sind zu KIs die sinnlos gegen die Wand laufen.

Es ist ungemein frustrierend sein Spielerlebnis durch sowas versaut zu bekommen. Und all das weil die für die Neuveröffentlichung keinen Finger krumm machen. Die holen sich mal eben einen Groschen ab indem sie was aus dem Regal nehmen und es nicht einmal abstauben bevor sie es ins Schaufenster stellen.

12410912.review:
Carlson y peters, en su capítulo 24 dicen:

Siempre es de agradecer ponerte a jugar a un juego que realmente desconoces, del que todo el mundo habla muy bien pero no sabes lo que te vas a encontrar, y llevarte una muy agradable sorpresa. En este caso, la protagonista, una reportera llamada Jade, tendrá que unirse a la resistencia y liberar al mundo de los domz, unos alienigenas que han invadido su planeta.

El juego es sencillamente genial, una mezcla de juego de acción en tercera persona, con toques de sigilo, exploración, conducción y hack and slash mezclado de tal forma que hace sencillo lo difícil, dando un conjunto un gran juego de aventuras.

Sus gráficos cartoon no desentonan para nada en el mundo en que están desarrollados, y la historia, sin ser una maravilla, engancha bastante.

Mención aparte la banda sonora de christopher heral, fantástica, en la que las canciones se adaptan perfectamente al momento. Es una mezcla entre reggaeton, música agitanada, rock y clásica, que si la escuchas independientemente del juego, puedes llegar a pensar, pero que mierda de canción, pero se me ha metido en la cabeza y no paro de tararearla y ya dentro del juego estan tan bien implemententadas que hay momentos que vuelves a entrar en algun minijuego solo por el hecho de oirla. Un diez para la Bso, porque mezcla estilos totalmente antaonistas y los hace quedar genial.

El punto negativo viene determinado por la lacra que acompaña el pc desde que salieron las consolas. El juego esta pensado para consola, y este port hace que manejarlo sin mando se haga bastante cuesta arriba y más cuando el juego, por defecto, no acepta mando (debes trastear con algun programa de emulación de mando) No digo que no se pueda (de hecho yo me lo he pasado con teclado y ratón) pero hay momentos, como en algunos cambios bruscos de cámara (sobretodo en sigilo) y en el enemigo final te hacen moverte para donde la da la gana al personaje y puede hacer llevarte una mal trago.

Pero eso no es culpa del juego en si, sino de sus programadores, por lo tanto, Carlson y Peters le mantienen una nota de  

8/10

CARLSON Y PETEEEERRSSS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. Cerdo, estas nominado!!

12238105.review:
This game is often mentioned as something special, and maybe it is, but ubisoft wont make it easy for you or me to find out.

It seems they've put this game on steam 'as-is', one would assume as a cash grab. They have not updated it for modern HW at all! If your GFX card is [u]younger[/u] than 10 years, or you have more than one cpu core (including HT) expect lots of problems; such as slowdowns, texture glitches, and the sound being out of sync with the action/video.

There are lots of posts about this easily found with google. Two solutions often come up that help a little: 1) set CPU affinity to just one CPU core (done with taskman), 2) Set GFX features to manual and turn most things off (google for specifics). oh and you will never be able to get rid of the warning about your GFX drivers being too old.

Steam does not know how many hours I've played because I start the game outside of steam with a .bat script, that tries to adjust some things for the game. I am some hours in and I can appreciate the charm that this games had and I can see why it's so beloved.

Unfortunately unless I can get it to play smothly (i.e. Ubisoft fixes the game), I am not sure I will ever love it.

If you want to play it, I'd suggest finding a 10 year old laptop with winxp to play it on. A real shame...
