11709200.review:
Мое знакомство с этой игрой относится к ныне далекому 2004 году, когда Я еще был юн, и когда все было одновременно и простым и немыслимым - прекрасное было время. Коробочку с заветной игрой мне дала подруга, оповестив о возможном экстазе по мере ознакомления с содержимым. Это и стало началом.
Я не хочу да и не буду Вас утомлять своим дотошным анализом, а скажу что это лучшая компьютерная игра, в которую мне довелось поиграть. Здесь есть все: совершенно удивительный сюжет, нескончаемые приключения, увлекательные диалоги, волнительные погони, превосходное озвучивание, харизматичные персонажи, непревзойденная проработка окружающего мира, достойное разнообразие уровней, развязные сражения, несравненный саундтрек и, конечно, незабываемый игровой процесс.
Сюжет игры мне очень понравился. Он трогательный. Живой. Интересный. К нему мне вспоминается одна цитата: "Для того, чтобы плыть против течения - рыба должна быть сильной, по течению может плыть даже мертвая рыба."
Так и главная героиня игры Джейд, на вид кажущаяся хрупкой юной девушкой, находит в себе силы для борьба за мир и свободу в приюте на маяке и Хиллии, конечно же не без помощи своего верного соратника и дяди Пейджа. И это все, что Вам нужно знать перед началом прохождения.
В целом мир BG&E прост, возможно поэтому так легко погружаешься в него. Сегодня играя в BG&E меня одолевает чувство приятной истомы, так как игра слишком сильно сплетена с моим удивительным детством.
В завершении скажу, что Мой обзор не для тех кто оценивает игры по графике или бешеным спецэффектам, а для Тех кто мысленно переносит себя в игровой мир, сопереживает героям и тяжело расстается с ними по завершении игры, так что если Вы один из таковых, эта игра для Вас.

11693765.review:
Ich habe dieses Spiel vor Jahren auf der Konsole gespielt und war ganz begeistert! Heute ist die Grafik zwar etwas verstaubt, die Kamerasteuerung an manchen Stellen ärgerlich sowie die Steuerung am PC zu Beginn gewöhnungsbedürftig- hat mich trotzdem nicht davon abgehalten, es dennoch zu spielen ;)
Das Wunderbare: das Spiel hat an Charme nichts eingebüsst! Die Geschichte ist gut durchdacht und spannend gestaltet, durch viele Nebenmissionen kann man sich auch abseits des Hauptstranges gut beschäftigen! Mir haben die vielen originellen Ideen gefallen, die in das Spiel eingeflossen sind- für mich nach wie vor TOP!!!

11644887.review:
"2006 zum ersten mal das Spiel gespielt und einfach nur WOW!
2010 mal wieder und es war einfach GENIAL das Spiel!
2014 wieder ein durchlauf und das Spiel ist einfach Wunderbar..." Zitat von Dj-Star, in der Spannenden Review.

Klar die Grafik ist zwar schon älter aber das Spiel kommt halt aus 2003 aber mal ganz ehrlich: Wieso gute Grafik wenn das Spiel vom Gameplay, Story, Soundtrack und Atmospähre überzeugen kann!?

Man Spielt Jade, eine Reporter'in, mit der Begleitung von Onkel Pey'j. Ihr seid zusammen im Team und müsst die Verschwörung aufdecken von der Armee, auch Alpha Ableitung genannt. Euch erwarten interesante, lustige und traurige Momente und andere im weiteren Spielverlauf die ich aufjedenfall nicht Spoilern will, das Spiel soll euch doch noch weiter Spaß machen :)

Wenn ihr das Spiel zu 100% durchspielen wollt, also auch alle Fotos von der Welt machen, alle Perlen finden und alle Renn auf Platz 1 schaffen, wird euch das Spiel länger Spaß machen. Beim ersten Durchlauf war es noch eine Herausforderung aber beim zweiten durchlauf war es kein Problem ;)

Die Soundtracks sind... ja einfach Toll! Egal in welcher Situation ist, die Soundtracks passen Perfekt. 
Mein Favorit ist Spanish Bar, läuft im Rennen 2, 3 und am Spieltisch bei Francis.

Die Steuerung ist mit Maus und Tastatur in sehr gut. Kann mich da nicht beschweren. Das Spiel müsste auch einige Gamepads unterstützen aber leider kann ich nicht sagen ob es ein Xbox360 Gamepad unterstützt. Hab so ein ding nicht.

Das Spiel funktioniert zumindest bei mir mit Windows 7 64bit ohne Probleme. Bei manchen leuten geht das wiederum nicht, deshalb sollte aufjedenfall die Windows XP Kompatibilität Modus helfen.


Leider gibts ein paar kleine Probleme mit den Spiel, so zum beispiel kann es sein wenn man die Wasser Details auf Hoch stellt, kann es sein das ihr im Wasser niedrige FPS bekommt, da hilft nur die Details auf Minimal zu stellen.
Auch kein Direkten Widescreen Support gibt es. Man muss im Internet nach ein Widescreen Tutorial suchen.
Wer diese probleme keine lust hat zu beheben, kauft sich die HD version für die PS3 oder Xbox360, dort gibts Widescreen Support, Trophen, Bestenlisten und kleine Soundverbesserung bei bestimmten Stellen. Ahja und die HD version von den Konsolen hat keine verbesserte Grafik, es ist rein die PC Grafik mit kleinen Verbesserung halt.

Von mir gibts eine fette Kaufempfehlung!
Wer da noch bei 4,99€ überlegt, dann kann ich da nicht mehr viel Helfen.
(Wieso gibts so wenige Spiele wie das... )

11539617.review:
This game is a classic. What i got to play of it looked good, and i wish i could have played the game on steam like i had intended... anyways, on with the review.

Havn't play much, and for good reason. List of issues i found within the first 15 minutes
-- No mouse control for the menus - small but very annoying
-- Game breaking graphical bugs that render the game unplayable - Bug and very annoying. The way to fix these is to fiddle with the options menu and disable some of the HD options added by Ubisoft. The options will not work, and only by disabling them will the game become playable. Notable features people had problems with are Shadow Detail (turn in down) and AA. Other features were found to cause problems for different systems.The only way to solve all your problems is to experiment in the out of game option menu.
-- Tearing - This will happen after you mess with your options. There really is no avoiding it if you actually want to play the game without the visuals and sound being scrambled beyond recognition.
-- "Your graphics card is out of date" - it just says this every time you open the game.

Ok so let me elaborate on why I'm writing this. If you see this game on steam, DON'T buy it! Buy it on GOG.com if anything, because at least there you will get help with fixing the issues. They also give you the soundtrack of the game, a vertual game guide, and a few other goodies. Much better value. The reason the game is in this state is because Ubisoft is terrible at PC ports... but this should is criminal. They sell you a defective product and offer no help, patches, or fixes to do anything about it.

11232119.review:
Firstly, I didn't have a chance to play this when it originally came out and I also don't have too much experience with the 3rd person action adventure genre, so this opinion is relatively nostalgia or genre prejudice free.

My issues with the game are mostly related to technical difficulties when attempting to get it up an running:

[list]
	[*] It'll always complain that your display drivers are out of date when launching (at least on an ATI card)
	[*] Audio goes off sync if you don't run it on a single core affinity
	[*] Your display settings need to be correct to avoid texture flickering
	[*] No out of box controller support for smoother analogue movement
[/list]

Probably something a patch or two could fix but they seem to have abandoned this one. You could also work around the controller issue by mapping the buttons using a 3rd party software such as JoyToKey, but you can't make it analogue though. I played this on keyboard and mouse due to that limitation and it's not bad, I just would've liked to play on the couch in Big Picture mode.

Apart from those technical issues I could say that everything else about the game is good. The story and the characters are likeable and well-written. I particularly liked Uncle Pey'j, who is probably now one of my favourite sidekick characters in all games. Voice acting was pretty much spot on for each character, maybe little on a campy side with different accents and all that, but as long as it fits.. Same could be said about the music.

I was a little worried that the early 2000s 3D graphics haven't aged well, but luckily my worries were in vain: Especially character movement and facial animations have stood the test of time and overall the game is still a pleasure to look at.

I wasn't really a fan of the face to face combat sequences, which occasionally just turned into mashing fests with little to no idea which enemy I was targeting. Your character, Jade, also locks into enemies which can make her a bit hard to control in combat. Stealth sections were a nice change of pace though, and I didn't have too much trouble with the camera that seems to have been an issue for others.

Solid fun for 10+ hours. I'm joining the group of people waiting for the sequel.

Когда я, удивившись, узнал, что она аж 2003 года издания, я подумал о том, что в детстве я её сильно переоценивал. Но это не так. Графика очень достойная, считай уровня инди в наше время. Здесь куча заговоров и тайн, за развитием событий смотришь с особым увлечением. 
В общем, шедевр на долгие, долгие годы.
1000/1000

10160398.review:
Beyond Good & Evil puts you in the role of Jade, a young woman who, along with her humanoid pig uncle Pey'j, runs a lighthouse on the planet Hillys. Hillys is at war with an alien force known as the DomZ, and an elite squadron known as the Alpha Sections protects Hillys from the alien threat. Or does it? An underground rebel organization known as the IRIS Network charges that the Alphas control both sides of the equation. IRIS is essentially a rogue news network, informing the people via a newsletter that strives to expose the link between Hillys' protectors and the alien menace. That's where Jade, a photographer-for-hire when not tending to the lighthouse, comes in. You quickly hook up with IRIS and spend the bulk of the game infiltrating Alpha strongholds.

But you won't go at it alone. The game gives you a companion most of the time, and many puzzles will require you to get your associate to do things. Only one contextual button is used to command your companion, so it's usually pretty easy to get him to act. The AI of your partner is usually pretty good, but we occasionally had to backtrack to get him unstuck from walls or railings.

Most of the game's interior sections have you out, on foot, and in search of photographic evidence. You're looking for specific pictures, and the areas of interest are marked on your map. The game does have combat, but it's a fairly straightforward system that suffices without excelling. The real meat of the gameplay comes from its puzzle-solving, though there's a little too much repetition in the puzzles, which can make some sections of the game feel pretty tedious. Almost every room will require you to do a little thinking. Sometimes it's as easy as using your projectile attack to push a button on the other side of a force field. Sometimes you'll have to find fuses in other parts of an installation to power elevators or other equipment. Sometimes you'll have to learn a password to proceed into a locked area. And there's a whole lot of sneaking around.

In Beyond Good & Evil, stealth is treated much like the rest of the game's puzzles. You simply want to get to the next room, but patrolling guards are in the way. So you'll either have to avoid detection by staying out of sight or incapacitate the guards by blinding them with a well-placed shot to the tank on their backs. A guard can repair another guard's faulty tank, so in rooms with multiple guards, you'll have to either be a fast shot or find a quieter way through. 

The game's 10- to 15-hour quest also has you piloting a hovercraft, which is your primary mode of transport on Hillys. The Hovercraft can shoot, and you'll upgrade it over time to fire more powerful blasts, as well as give it the ability to jump. Upgrading your Hovercraft requires you to spend pearls at an upgrade shop. Pearls are fairly rare on Hillys and you'll get them in various ways ( for example  by defeating bosses or purchasing them from seedy merchants using credits, the game's main currency which you can earn by defeating enemies, find them in crates or by taking photos of the different animals in the game).
The game controls quite well with a mouse and keyboard, using fairly standard third-person action game controls that are, of course, fully configurable.

While the game behind the presentation is pretty good on its own, the entire package benefits from some pretty nice audio and video. The game is graphically impressive. The world of Hillys is beautifully rendered. It's large and atmospheric, and the outdoor segments show off some nice-looking water. The interior of the buildings you'll be infiltrating are appropriately dark and intimidating, with a hefty dose of effective lighting. The game's shadows usually look great, as well, though we noticed a couple of instances of shadows being unnaturally cast on walls and ceilings. It's a minor point, for sure, but given how amazing the rest of the game looks, little things like that tend to stick out. While the console versions of the game look outstanding in their own right (played on Nintendo Gamecube), the PC version definitely has a sharper, cleaner look to it. The water effects, well-placed blur effects, reflections, textures, and models really jump off the screen.

While the game's repetitive nature and short length take away from its overall impact, Beyond Good & Evil is a fantastic-looking game that tells its story well. It may be short enough to complete in a day or two, but fans of action adventure games will find enough to love in the game's overall design to make it worth purchasing.

It's a shame that this amazing game was never properly recognized. If you're a fan of action adventure games, look no further because this is the best you can get, even in comparison with today's titles. 

I won't summarize the story, but let me just write that the main character is an independent young woman named Jade who happens to be a reporter on a planet that is currently in the middle of a war. Although your main task is to uncover the cospiracy that involves your planet's government, there are also side quests you can work on, the best being photographing all the species you encounter. The atmosphere and story are excellent, and some characters you simply have to love (Pey'j). The game balances stealth and action well and once you get used to the controls, it's pretty intuitive. For 5 euro, it's a must have.

Beyond Good and Evil kenne ich bereits seit seiner ursprünglichen Veröffentlichung.
Ich spiele seit über 30 Jahren am Compuer und muss sagen, dass dies das Spiel ist, dass meiner Meinung nach am meisten unterschätzt worden ist.
Die Welt in BG&E ist schlüssig, das Spiel hat ein besonderes Charisma, besondere Figuren und einen besonderen Humor.
Zugleich ist es sehr originell.
Schleicheinlagen kennt man, Nahkämpfe mit dem Stab auch, aber dass man beim Auftauchen eines Monster spontan besser erstmal das Ding fotografiert statt darauf einzuschlagen, ist neu!
Auch die Musik ist hervorragend und aussergewöhnlich (ich liebe "Propaganda").
Daher meine absolute Empfehlung für Spieler, die mal etwas -anderes-, -charismatisches- spielen wollen.
(Eigentlich schade, dass man von Hand nachpatchen muss - Ubisoft! Korrigiert das!)

9312160.review:
Man, this game
This is more than a 3rd Person beat em up, this is a 3rd person stealth adventure racing game with collecting elements and you CAN beat people up. The story is decent, but the characters are all very loveable, especially Jade, the spunky, tough tomboy you play as. You simply CAN'T play this game correctly without going out of your way to collect photos of the great amount of fauna that litters Hillys, competing in the races, or hunting down the pearls. You can probably go through most of the game pacifistically, but you can also kill everything in sight. Personally, it gives me a very Jak and Daxter feeling, and I find it very charming. This version is kind of a pain to play though, basically, what you have to do, is turn water reflections off and WHILE you're in game, go to your task manager, go to processes, right click BGE, go to affinities, and select only one core. The way it worked for me is you had to close the task manager and turn the game off, then turn it on again. Even then, there were some issues with the framerate and sound lag. It was annoying, especially at the end when there's a lot of shit going on. But overall it's a very good game that I enjoyed nearly every second of, and I recommend it to all of you.

Now for the experience I had while playing this game was very nastolgic like. I never played this game before, yet it felt like I was right back in the Ps1-Ps2 era of console gaming. This game does have a lot to it, and one of the really great things about this game that stands out almost right away is the soundtrack. 
The combat system in this game is really fun, but it doesn't expand as much as it should of. I only found one Attack powerup, but maybe I missed a hidden one somewhere. 

The game is still challenging at parts. 
The only downside I had with the game was learning the hard way that there is no Autosave. Save at the M-disk spots! 
All in all, this game was a very fun experience and I already plan to play it through again one day.

Etwas älter, sicher, sieht man auch an der Grafik, aber es hat Charisma!
Man ist Jade, eine Reporterin und lebt auf einem von Aliens geplagten Planeten. Es verschwinden immer wieder Personen und man hat schon einige Waisen in seinem Leuchturm aufgenommen, die das belegen. Wir müssen primär erst einmal Geld einnehmen, da wir Strom benötigen. Also schießen wir erst einmal eifrig Bilder aller Tiere die uns vor die Linse kommen. Doch wir bekommen auch Aufträge, die wir bearbeiten können und wir treten dem Untergrund bei, um dem Geheimnis der verschwundenen beizukommen und die Invasion der Aliens vielleicht zu stoppen.
Die Steuerung geht leicht von der Hand, man hat viel zu erkunden und zu fotografieren, die Geschichte ist immer noch toll - alles in allem, zwar älter, aber immer noch zu empfehlen!

L'univers est magnifique et cohérent, il nous emmene sur un hyllis, une planète pacifique, rempli d'animaux qui voyage entre imaginaire et réalité.

9230430.review:
One of the best games I've ever played..

(If you just want to see my rating of this game, scroll right down to the bottom)

I once bought this game, almost ten years ago retail. Never managed to finish it back then, cue to my computer crashing. The new one couldn't handle the disc..

But now, steam has it, and I finally got to finishing it.
Great story, great gameplay, has some stealth, racing, photographing, good dungeons, puzzle solving, amongst other things. It has some camera issues though, you might get annoyed by the fact that the camera is a bit hard to handle sometimes.

Overall, I've had a great experience. The story and characters are all great and well-made, and the gameplay is well done although you might think "photographing as a gameplay element, what?"
It is a bit shorter than many modern day games though, since back then you couldn't fit all that much onto a disc so it couldn't grow as massive as it wanted. (what I mean is, don't expect a twenty-hour long odyssey from this, I got through the whole game in just seven hours).

For those who may be wondering, this game does not have multiplayer, it is singleplayer only. Meaning no versus, co-op or other such things.

However, it is a bit poorly ported to the newer OS-versions, meaning that it will probably not be fully functional straight-off. Graphical and sound issues are the most common problems, and for some users it doesn't even start. However, ti did start for me, and the graphics bugs I fixed by turning off "HW vertex processing" in the advanced settings of the game's startup menu. The sound issue I've heard is related to multi-core, and mostly fixed by telling the game to use only one core. Still, I would recommend that you turn on subtitles, just in case. (it doesn't always work flawlessly with the voice, occasionally some pieces have been known to disappear..)

Still, though, a really great game. 
To summarise, you should really consider buying this straight up, right now, if you don't mind a few problems, many which are quite easily fixed for some people. 

Of course, since these bugs vary from player to player I cannot know which ones you are going to have (for me only the graphical issues, along with some occasional missing sound in dialogue or music, were present. The repeating voice bug, was not) so therefore I will not take these bugs into consideration when rating this.

If I disregard the problems that arrived when getting this to newer OS, this would get a solid 9/10 from me.

9148441.review: One of a select few games to live up to the 'action adventure' mantle. Platforming, stealth and combat are basic but satisfying, and what it lacks mechanically, it makes up for in content and character. Looks lovely even without the HD textures, boasts one of the all-time great orchestral soundtracks, a wealth of entertaining side-quests and mini-games, and the best photography mechanic since Pokemon Snap. It won't be for everyone - this port lacks native controller support, and it's from that era of mid-tier open world games that can make it feel a little limited in scope. But ultimately has buckets of charm, a unique if underexplored setting, and packs a lot of content into a short run time. Well overdue a hopefully inevitable HD remaster now the sequel is finally confirmed.

9099914.review:
Невероятно увлекательная и стильная игра, благодаря которой современные игры выглядят так, как надо.

Когда я запускал эту игру, я знал что меня ждёт одна из лучших игр на свете. Столько про неё было сказано и написано, что я решил узнать, за что её так любят. Было интересно получить опыт, у игры изменившей игровую индустрию, опередившей своё время. И вот, я установил русификатор, запустил игру и навсегда запомнил этот момент. Момент, когда я понял, что я всё это время играл не в те игры.

“Игра 2003 года, как я буду в неё играть?” – такие слова звучали в моей голове, я боялся, что она не оправдает моих ожиданий и в ней будет геймплей старой, абсолютно дешёвой игры. И каково было моё удивление, когда я осознал, что она ничуть не устарела. Действительно, здесь не надо заучивать карту, париться из за боевой системы (которая построена на двух кнопках), пугаться стелса, ты просто расслабляешься и играешь. Может здесь и надо сохраняться самому да следить за полоской здоровья, но это не отвлекает от процесса. Здесь есть открытый мир, транспорт (единственный способ перемещения между локациями), мини-игры, безумно крутая музыка и потрясающий визуальный стиль.

Собственно, о сюжете и персонажах. Протагонистом игры является молодая и очаровательная журналистка Джейд. Она, вместе со своим дядюшкой Пейджем содержит приют для сирот, чьих родителей похитили инопланетяне. Её дядя, прямоходящий и заботливый свин, всячески помогает ей и даёт советы в тех или иных ситуациях. С каждым персонажем (кроме врагов и животных) можно пообщаться и узнать, как отражаются твои поступки на жизни людей. К таким поступкам относятся шпионаж против корпуса "Альфа", который мы всю игру будем пытаться разоблачить. К слову о шпионаже, здесь он выглядит следующим образом: вы “по-тихому” пробираетесь на территорию врага и стараясь не спалиться, фотографируете “грязную работу” корпуса “Альфа”. Фотографировать придётся много, ибо за каждую фотографию местной фауны вы получаете денежное вознаграждение, в зависимости от редкости животного. После определённого количества снимков, вам дадут награду побольше, сначала это будет макронасадка, а потом жемчужины (единственное средство покупки запчастей для транспорта в мастерской “Маммаго”).

В Beyond видна ручная работа над каждой локацией и игровым моментом. Она практически не повторяется. Каждый противник (да, здесь есть боссы) оригинален и требует особого подхода. Одного нужно долбануть током, другого оглушить и добить палкой, а от “миротворцев” корпуса просто прятаться в тени (или подобраться сзади и ударить по баллону с газом). В общем, скучно не будет. Музыкальное сопровождение навсегда запоминается и скачивается с официального сайта HD ремейка. С визуальной точки зрения игра радует глаз и создаёт атмосферу хорошей сказки. За прохождение у вас должно накопиться много скриншотов в духе “я стою на фоне города возле красивого дерева” или “я вижу кита”. Причём их не стыдно поставить на рабочий стол как фоновую картинку.

[i]Я виню себя в одном, что не поиграл в эту игру раньше. Сейчас, играя в Beyond, я говорю: “Ух-ты, прямо как в Uncharted”. А должен был наоборот, играя в Uncharted говорить “прямо как в Beyond Good & Evil”. Неважно, какие игры вам нравятся, вы обязаны поиграть в неё, иначе вы пропустите одну из лучших игр на свете. Потратьте 200 рублей, и купите её. Ведь такие игры никогда не забываются.[/i]

P.S. Статья взята с сайта Игры@Mail.ru, так как автором являюсь я.

8968195.review: To be perfectly honest I have no idea why this game gets all the praise it does, maybe I went into it with too high of expectations or maybe it just hasn't aged well but I was not blown out of the water by Beyond Good and Evil. That being said, it’s a good game. The combat is really fun, controls really well(outside of the flying parts) and it’s varied enough that it never really gets boring. The story, while not super amazing, is still pretty decent. There’s a lot they could have done with it that wasn’t done and with the namesake it has I really expected more out of the story. Even though the story was underwhelming the most standout part of this game, and the most enjoyable, is definitely the 100% believable female protagonist. It’s really nice to be able to play a woman who isn’t overly sexualized or a stereotypical manly, badass female. Unlike so many other female protagonist Jade is written like she’s a real, well rounded person. More writers need to play this game so they can learn how to write realistic characters, both female and male.

8436082.review: Beyond Good and Evil is a fabulous work of art that originally was released for the PS2, GC, Xbox, and those early 2000's pcs.  The game's story is amazing backed up by emotional moments, compeiling characters, and the need to find out just who is really orchestrating the DomZ attacks and who is kidnapping the citizens of Hillys.  Furthermore is the graphics, I don't tend to focus on graphics much, but, Beyond Good and Evil deserves for its graphics to be praised for a world that draws you into it beauty and to this day has aged quite well.  And the music fits every mood rather it be a tough boss battle or sad cutscene.  Gameplay is also solid--Jade's movements in battle always feel smooth and well executed.  Perhaps the most interesting thing I thought about the gameplay was how it combined not just the action adventure of a Zelda game, but the stealth you would find in such as Metal Gear.  Now there are some issues with this game I should address but shouldn't stop you from playing the game.  One, is that the game has not been optimized for modern day pcs, in fact as soon as you start the game you are given an error that your 'Graphics Card' has not been updated to the latest version, but at least you can still play it.  Then theres problems with sometimes flickering graphics and such, and one of the worst that ruined a very important scene in the game near the end was at the middle of the cutscene the sound absolutely stopped (I had to reload an earlier save, turn on subtitles and go through it again just to hear them).  In other words this game is a straight out port of the pc version that has not been optimized for modern day pcs.  But even though it has issues with modern day pcs I found that it was still enjoyable as it was back when it was released.  I suggest Ubisoft releases a patch so that Beyond Good and Evil can run on modern day pcs better, much better.  If you can deal with the issues then you will certainly have a blast playing this overlooked great game.  However if you don't want to deal with the issues then I suggest you buy the HD version on Xbox 360 or PS3.

8379020.review:
This is probably one of the best games I have ever played. Super fun, very well paced and really interesting characters and story. It plays out sorta like a Legend of Zelda game (The action adventure genre) where you slowly gain more items, health and trinkets while you play the game and explore the world. The game is decently challenging without going overboard.
One thing I remember a lot about this game was how the world actually changed over time as different events happened throught the game. You know how in most games, some big crazy event happens, but when you go the the main town everyone is still running around like nothing ever happened. In this game, the world and people living in it visable change as events happen. This is something I don't feel like happens in games (I have no idea why) but really helps make the world feel real and keeps you immersed.
I highly recommend this game. It's cheap and totally worth every minute.

One of the best games you've probably never played.  Beyond Good and Evil is an action adventure game that I think everyone should play.  The PC version is probably the worst version, in my opinion, but even with that it is still worth buying.  The graphics hold up surprisingly well and look great.  Don't let the colorful graphics fool you though, the story is surprisingly mature.

The game has awesome/likable characters, a good story, a strong female lead who isn't over sexualized, the list goes on.  It isn't perfect though, especially not this version.  The game begs to be played with a controller, there are invisible walls all over the place which can be annoying sometimes and there are some bugs not in the console versions like the flickering graphics bug.

Overall, this is a criminally underrated/underappreciated game that I think everyone should play.

A-

Ein umwerfend schönes Spiel mit der schlechtesten PC-Steuerung die ich bisher erlebt habe. Es hat eine unglaublich fesselnde und schöne Story die sich wirklich bis zum Ende hin durchzieht. 
"Kurze" Erläuterung der Story: Man ist Jade, die sich gerade in einer ziemlich schweren Zeit befindet. Mit ihrem Onkel Pey'j siedelt Sie sich mit einigen Kindern in einem scheinbar sicheren Leuchtturm an. Die DomZ, so heißen die Gegner in diesem Spiel, greifen immer häufiger den Planeten Hillys an. Als die DomZ schließlich den Leuchtturm von Jade angreifen, und Sie bei diesem Angriff, trotz ihrer Waffen, dann doch nichts mehr tun kann, tritt plötzlich die Alpha-Abteilung ins geschehen, die immer an Ort und Stelle sind, sobald irgendetwas passiert. Doch irgendetwas scheint selbst mit denen nicht zu stimmen.

Trotz des Alters hat dieses Spiel immer noch schöne Grafiken, bei denen sich auch sichtlich sehr viel Mühe gemacht wurden. Wenn ihr also ein gutes Gamepad habt und diesem Spiel ein paar Stunden gebt, dann Lohnen sich die paar Euronen auf jeden Fall.

Bis Heute Teil meiner All Time favorite Games - 10/10 (Gamepad)

8173299.review:
Beyond Good & Evil es una aventura que mezcla plataformas, sigilo y toques sencillos de Hack & Slash.

Pros:
- Fases de sigilo muy buenas.
- Buena historia.
- Buena banda sonora.

Contras:
- Parpadeos de texturas habituales.
- La cámara se puede volver insoportable por momentos.
- Sistema de combate simple.

Conclusión:
Beyond Good & Evil es un gran juego de aventuras en el que las fases de sigilo están muy bien conseguidas, la historia es buena y la banda sonora igual con lo que cualquier fan de las aventuras lo disfrutará muchísimo. El sistema de combate peca de bastante simple aunque si vas con sigilo apenas tendrás que usarlo a lo largo del juego. Su peor defecto son los múltiples fallos gráficos como el parpadeo de las texturas (que resultan bastante molestos) y una cámara que, en momentos puntuales, te volverá loco.

Puntuación: 8/10

7939526.review:
[u][b]Story[/b][/u]:
Year 2435 on the planet Hillys.
After an attack by the Domz, Jade - the protagonist - got involved into an underground network which wants to find out the truth about the alien invaders.
It's up to you now to investigate the connection between the attacking Domz and the defending army called 'Alpha Section'.

As I don't want to spoil any content:
Touching story! I'm sure you will enjoy it.

[u][b]Gameplay[/b][/u]:
While running, driving, sneaking and even flying a space ship, you have to take pictures of creatures or your targets of evidence and fighting the enemies who will show you that visitors are not welcome.

[u][b]my opinion[/b][/u]:
The mixed game style of sneaking and taking pictures as evidence on the one hand and fighting against the Domz on the other is not for everyone but after ten years this is stil one of the best stories in a video game I've ever played. It is just amazing!
It's really a shame that this game did never recieve the attention it deserves.

Definetly worth every cent - not to mention that it's on 75% sale quiet often.

[u][b]other words I wanna share[/b][/u]:
The default keyboard settings are kinda mixed up.
 - '[b]E[/b]': Jump 
 - '[b]Space[/b]': Camera
It kinda reminds me of The elder Scrolls III Morrowind - It had the exact same weird switched bindings (Space was 'use' there).
Just Switch the two buttons and enjoy :)

7918427.review:
The gameplay was enjoyable even though I'm not a huge fan of games with stealth elements. There were quite many mini-games as well, which were fairly enjoyable too. The story was good and I will probably get the sequel, if it ever comes out on PC (currently in development for the next generation of consoles). Only real downside was the length of the game since I beat the game in about 11 hours and I collected and did everything during that time. There were only 3-4 quite lengthy missions in the game, each with a boss in the end.

The game is kinda old though and doesn't work that well on modern computers. There were some graphical glitches at first but with a little bit of tweaking, I managed to make them disappear.

Overall the game was good and I recommend playing it to everyone who likes stealthy action-adventure games.

7833087.review:
[b]Персональный рейтинг - 6 из 10[/b]

Я долго не решался написать этот текст, но потом решил, что называть соль сладкой глупо и если хочешь сказать - скажи.

Есть в этом мире вещь с которой невозможно бороться, которой глупо сопротивляться и испытание, что оно дает, пожалуй, самое ответственное из всех. Это время. Все подвержено старению и что-то, что когда-то будоражило умы сегодня не более чем тень, след на песке. Как видно, касается это и игр.

При всем уважении к творчеству Mишеля Анселя, сегодня Beyond Good & Evil смотрится бледно и невыразительно. Играть в нее скучно, огромные локации более не поражают воображение, механика примитивна и бесхитростна. Про визуальную сторону говорить не будем. Особо не приглянулся мне сеттинг игры - архипелаг планеты Хиллис, где происходит действие, выглядит как винегрет из разных культур, стилей и образов, не имеющий своего лица. 

Beyond Good & Evil - добрая, занятная игра, но ее время прошло. Но прошлое никуда не исчезает, порой оно лишь перетекает в иную форму. И впереди сиквел, друзья, и потому Джейд и ее дядя Пейдж обязательно вернутся. Чтобы вновь унести нас в сказочную страну...

7824552.review:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
*LEIA O FIM DA PÁGINA PARA VER AS SOLUÇÕES PARA OS PROBLEMAS COM COMPUTADORES MODERNOS*
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Esse jogo é um clássico da era dourada da Ubisoft. Lançado em 2003 para PC, PS2, XBOX e GameCube conta com todas as características que tanto amamos em games como Super Mario 64, Psychonauts (que na realidade foi lançado em 2005 e tem semelhanças com BGE), Rayman, Zelda, Okami e Prince of Persia: Sands of Time.

Neste título voce controla Jade, uma jornalista que mantém um lar de adoção para crianças órfãs cujos pais desapareceram devido à uma invasão alienígena. 

Jade mora no planeta Hillys que já há algum tempo vem sofrendo constantes ataques (cada vez mais graves) por parte de uma raça alienígena invasora (DomZ). Ela tem sua casa orfanato atacada no início do jogo devido à uma falha no sistema de escudos, e tem que lutar para derrotar os invasores e reativar os escudos.

Ainda bem que ela conta com a ajuda de seu tio Pey’j (que é um porco humanóide), que sempre à segue em suas aventuras e contribui com a utilização de habilidades especiais como cortar cercas, ajuda no combate, etc. (é basicamente como se vc estivesse jogando um game coop mas sozinho :p).

Durante o desenrolar da trama Jade passa de uma simples repórter à membro de uma organização secreta que opõe resistência ao governo Alpha Section (uma ditadura militar que descobrem estar aliados aos aliens).

Além de Pey’j, Jade também recebe ajuda de Secundo, que é uma Inteligência Artificial presente em seu computador móvel que dá dicas frequentes ao longo do jogo.

A jogabilidade é em terceira pessoa a maior parte do tempo mas é possível mudar para primeira pessoa para utilizar a camera fotográfica e o gps do barco (o que também serve para melhor visualizar e analizar o ambiente).

O jogo apresenta combate (tanto combate marcial que a jade usa ao longo do jogo com combos e etc como sessões de tiro quando vc esta dentro do hovercraft), stealth, quebra cabeças, missões secundárias como corridas e uma mecânica de fotos onde vc deve fotografar diferentes espécies animais para uma cientista em troca de dinheiro (ela está montando um catálogo com todas as espécies do planeta).

O mundo do jogo é bem amplo e vc é livre para navegar em grande parte dele (utilizando um hovercraft (espécie de barco) para navegar entre as diferentes áreas que incluem uma cidade, cavernas de mineração, ilhas, etc.

Conta também com um sistema de upgrade onde vc deve juntar recursos para melhorar o motor, armas e vitalidade do seu hovercraft.

Tanto para a época quanto até mesmo para hoje em dia o jogo é bem inovador e bem amplo, além disso é muito divertido (especialmente a parada de fotografar as espécies animais que tem um gostinho de "Temos que pegar, Pokemon!"), personagens engraçados e um enredo bacana.

RECOMENDO!!!


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

ps.: Infelizmente devido à idade do jogo alguns podem ter problemas gráficos e de performance rodando em computadores modernos, mas não criemos pânico, tudo pode ser resolvido seguindo alguns simples passos:

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Para rodar o jogo em resoluções Widecreen: 


1- Menu Iniciar > Todos os Programas > Acessórios > Executar > Digite regedit e pressione enter
 

2- Navegue até " HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Ubisoft\Beyond Good & Evil\SettingsApplication.INI\Basic video. 


3- Selecione "Basic video". Agora clique com o botão direito em uma área em branco do lado direito da janela e crie um novo valor DWORD (32 bits).
Voce deve nomear esse valor exatamente como "NoBands" (sem as aspas obviamente). 

4- Finalmente de doois cliques no valor que vc acabou de criar e defina o valor de NoBands para 1 em "Dados do Valor" (vai estar em 0 por padrão), clique ok e feche o regedit. 

Prontinho, agor seu jogo estará rodando em resoluções widescreen sem aquelas barrinhas pretas chatas! 



--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Já para corrigir os problemas de performance e texturas corrompidas (piscando):

1- Navegue até a pasta onde o jogo está instalado, geralmente "C:\Arquivos de Programas\Steam\SteamApps\common\Beyond Good and Evil" ou para Windows 7: "C:\Arquivos de Programas (x86)\Steam\SteamApps\common\Beyond Good and Evil"

2- Execute "SettingsApplication"

3- Vá até Advanced Settings (última aba)

4- Desative "AntiAliasing" (mova a barrinha toda para a esquerda até Off), o resto pode deixar no máximo

5- Agora marque o quadradinho da direita que diz "Manual compatibility settings" e desative (desmarque) as seguintes opções:

 - Triple-buffering
 - HW Vertex Processing 
 - Multi vertex stream
 - W buffer 
 - Fastflip

Deixe marcados:

 - SSE
 - Mipmapping
 - Autogen mipmap

6- Clique em "Save" e depois "Play" para jogar ou "Quit" caso não queira iniciar o jogo imediatamente. 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Prontinho, agora é só aproveitar este incrível game! ;)

7396403.review:
I first found Beyond Good & Evil as a used PS2 game in a Blockbuster and thought it looked interesting. The cover art was intriguing, and the basic description caught my attention. However, the first few times I tried to play the game, I could not get through it because I did not have the patience to solve some of the challenges. Then one day in college, I picked it up over a weekend, deciding to play for the heck of it and to finish it once and for all. 

Am I glad I did.

The game immerses you in the story from the get-go, forgoing the typical long, drawn-out backstory. The characters are warm and engaging, and all of them, major and minor, are full of depth and life. This is the only game that can honestly make me say I was sad to leave the world when I completed it, and it is the only game I can pick up once every few months and play again, even though I already know the answers to all of the puzzles and where to find all of the hidden items. So imagine my heartbreak when my PS2 copy started to glitch each time I started a new file, and my joy finding that it is available on Steam for only ten dollars!

This game was well-thought out and developed, and I can say without a doubt that it is my favorite game. I am proud to own both the original PS2 copy and now to own it on Steam.

314167.review:
Michael Ancel hat es einfach raus. Der Erfinder von Rayman liefert für Ubisoft nicht nur derzeit einen genialen Jump'n'Run Titel nach dem anderen ab, sondern hat auch Beyond Good & Evil in seinem Portfolio.

Das Spiel erscheint 2003 für die damalige Konsolengeneration sowie für den PC und wird von Kritikern in den Himmel gelobt. Nur der kommerzielle Erfolg bleibt aus unerfindlichen Gründen aus.

Beyond spielt auf dem Planeten Hyllis, dessen Bewohner schon lange von feindlichen Aliens angegriffen werden. Um dieser Bedrohung Herr zu werden hat sich die Alpha-Abteilung gegründet, die mit militärischen Mitteln den Widersachen an den Kragen will. Wir spielen hierbei Jade eine Journalistin, die zusammen mit ihrem Onkel Pey'j, einem menschlichen Schwein in einem Leuchtturm lebt. Nachdem dieser von den Aliens angegriffen wird erhalten die beiden einen Auftrag, der sie mit der Rebellengruppe IRIS vertraut macht, die eine Verbindung zwischen den Aliens und der Alpha-Abteilung vermuten. Als Journalistin macht sich Jade natürlich sofort auf den Weg und geht der Sache auf den Grund.

Beyond ist ein Spiel das Herz hat. Nicht nur, dass die Kämpfe fordernd und die Rätsel und Schleichpassagen in den Zelda-ähnlichen Dungeons spannend sind. Vor allem die Charaktere überzeugen mit ihrem unglaublichen Charme. Sie führen dazu, dass man keine Sekunde an dieser bunten und verrückten Welt zweifeln möchte sondern sich jederzeit von der Geschichte mitreißen lässt.

Genial sind auch die kleinen Nebentätigkeiten in das Spiel eingefügt, denen man sich neben der Hauptstory widmen kann. Neben den Wettrennen und den Piratenjagden mit dem Hovercraft ragt vor allem das Sammeln von Tierbildern als ein spaßiges Vergnügen heraus. Als Journalistin hat Jade natürlich jederzeit ihre Kamera dabei. So bekommt sie die Aufgabe für wissenschaftliche Studien alle Tierwesen zu fotografieren, die sie während ihrer Reise trifft. Neben der Genugtuung am Sammeln springt dabei für jede fotografierte Tierart ein bisschen Geld und manchmal auch Perlen heraus, die sich gegen Verbesserungen für das Hovercraft eintauschen lassen.

Beyond Good & Evil macht einfach Spaß und das von vorne bis hinten. Noch ist nicht klar, ob der zweite Teil jemals das Licht der Welt erblicken wird. Solange sich Ancel's Rayman verkauft wie blöde wird Ubisoft wohl kaum das Risiko wagen eine Fortsetzung zu einem gefloppten Adventure herauszubringen. Aber solange habt ihr ja noch den starken ersten Teil, der euch tolle Nachmittage verspricht und mir ein Lächeln auf den Mund gezaubert hat wie es seit einigen Jahren kein Spiel mehr geschafft hat.

2293892.review: I had originally purchased this game shortly after it was released on Playstation 2. Tragically, I could never make a dent of progress in the game at the time because I didn't have a memory card for quite awhile. Nearly 10 YEARS went by before I saw this familiar face on Steam and decided to experience the game once and for all..and I am SO glad I did. Beyond Good & Evil is a great example of how a game with a simple story doesn't need violence, sexy aliens, or DLC to compete with today's sci-fi genre games. Instead- charming characters, beautiful music, gorgeous art style that has aged very well considering the advances in tech. A good portion of the game focuses on stealth aspects, though not as hardcore as the average -I CAUGHT YOU, YOU DEAD! game. Jade is one cool girl: she has a talking pig uncle, cares for orphans, full of energy and charisma that make her a believable character. Armed with only a staff, projectile launching glove, and a camera Jade must uncover the big secrets- about her planet Hillys, the alien race that seeks to harm them, as well as  a stunning introspection of herself.

4073336.review:
I call this game the original Mirrors Edge. An amazing storyline, amazing concept, utterly unique (especially for it's time!), but shitty marketing. Thanks to that last slipup, this game was a sleeper hit, so not many people were really aware of this one until after the three month marketing was done. However! I preordered it when nintendo power bragged about it. Was never regretting that one. This game is deep, and I mean DEEP. One of the first great conspiracy stories in video games, expertly told with an underground, veneer peeling vibe. Not to give anything away, but the light and colorful starting world goes far beyond itself, showing how everything truly is. As philosophical as the title book was (Nietzche, don't get much more philosophical!), this story hits pretty close. 
But for you gameplay oriented people out there, this game is still good. It takes a bit of time to get used to antiquated controls and glitches, as this game was FAR smaller than most modern ones, but it created many of the engines later used. The camera support is very nice, the combat is fairly set up (but simple), but the majority of the game relies on caring about the world and the story, so if you like a good tale? Play this game. Help make them WANT to make the sequel we all need.

Beyond Good and Evil ist heute und damals für mich eines der besten Spiele aus dem Haus Ubisoft.

Die Grafik mag zwar nicht Top aktuell sein aber das gleicht dieser Titel mit einer glaubwürdigen Story, guter Musik, Gameplay und der Atmosphäre mehr als aus.

Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist sehr moderat. Als Anfänger wird man sanft an das Gameplay und die Kämpfe herangeführt und später gilt es das erlernte an den richtig Harten feinden umzusetzen. Zur Seite gestellt werden hier zwei weitere Figuren, denen man mitten im Kampf über Simple tasten befehle geben kann.

Die Partnerfiguren sind auch bei diversen Sidequest und Rätseln eine Hilfe und von Ersterem gibt es in diesem Spiel nicht zu Knapp. Sei es Informationen sammeln, Perlen suchen, Minispiele oder das bekämpfen von Alienseeschlangen mit eurem Hovercraft oder Raumschiff. Zu tun gibt es immer etwas und ist für 100% Zocker eine Herausforderung.

Ich spreche für diesen Titel meine volle Empfehlung aus und hoffe ihr testet das Game trotz der älteren Grafik.

4214395.review: Une fierté française. On devrait forcer les sportifs locaux à porter un t-shirt à l'effigie de Pey'j en chantant la marseillaise la main sur son coeur. Beyond Good & Evil est un jeu ambitieux, varié et parfaitement maîtrisé qui nous transporte dans son aventure et son univers. Un océan verdâtre mélancolique d'où émerge un bleu de tendresse dans lequel s'agitent des personnages généreux et pleins d'humour : Beyond Good & Evil, c'est la joie qui surgit hors de la fadesse, la poésie qui redessine avec l'aide d'une douce musique les contours des bâtiments désincarnés d'un monde fait de récupération qui tombe en ruines. Combats, énigmes, courses, exploration, open world, donjons et mini-jeux. Par sa maîtrise et sa richesse, le bijou de Michel Ancel illustre ce que la génération 128 bits pouvait accoucher de mieux. Ce jeu d'action-aventure aux faux airs de Zelda-like léger, bourré d'idées de game design, n'est jamais lassant. Beyond Good & Evil distille toute une palette d'émotions entre rire et enchantement. S'abandonner à rêver le temps d'un voyage en hydroglisseur sur des plaines aquatiques, regarder le ballet de cette fausse faune qui fait semblant de vivre ; faire semblant d'y croire. Un très beau voyage.

540870.review:
~~ [ Rating ] ~~

98/100. 

~~ [ Reasons] ~~

Other than Graphical Hiccups (hard to find), and the occassional desync of sound in cutscenes, this is by far one of the best games you could find and play. With Action, Drama, Puzzles, Justice, Revenge and Cameras, this game is a classic gem (being released on the PS2, now on PC), that not many people have heard of or played, even being given big reviews.

~~ [ Pros ] ~~

+Brilliant Story
+Good Voice Acting
+Vehicles are fun
+Combat is fun and challenging at times
+Around 12 hours

~~ [ Cons ] ~~
-Infrequent Graphical Hiccups
-Windows 7 has compatability issues (can be easily fixed)
-Desync of Sound in Cutscenes on older machines
-Companions can get stuck in places where they can't go {very rare, fixed by loading}.

~~ [ Is the Game worth it's value? ] ~~

This game is worth 10 times what it's worth. Buy it, play it. You will NOT be disappointed.

~~ [ Summary ] ~~
Meet Jade. She's a brunette beauty with an eye for mystery and a camera to uncover it. When the would-be heroine's futuristic planet is threatened by aliens, Jade finds herself thrust into the heart of a vicious conspiracy that could stretch to the very top of her government. This stylized, extremely gorgeous third-person action-adventure plays very much like a Zelda game.

Jade can explore a huge, water-covered world by hovercraft or take to a variety of islands and interact with merchants, or tackle assignments to earn money and advance the surprisingly deep and intriguing storyline that surrounds her quest. She can also gain a number of items and weapons that are integral to advancing and a lot of fun to wield. Packed full of twists and turns and even a talking man-pig, Ubisoft has crafted yet another big adventure series.

1417372.review:
Это прекраснейшая игрушка, которую можно проходить не один раз! С самого первого действия - игра затягивает и в нее хочется играть снова и снова. Очень динамичная для своего времени, красиво сделана и безумно музыкальна! Я в предвкушении 2ой части уже не первый год, ролик можете посмотреть на youtube. В игре очень яркие и запоминающиеся персонажи, которые придают жизни и хочется бегать, выполнять всяческие квесты и просто отдыхать душой. 
Это сейчас мы уже ничему не удивляемся, хотя люди стараются нас встряхнуть своими проектами. Разработчики преподнесли нам мир BG&E не масштабным, но места в нем хватает. Да, когда проходишь очередной раз игрушку, все больше и больше хочется где-нибудь что-то исследовать, но не в этот раз. Мир открыт, но он однокомнатный.
В игре нам доведется играть за девушку Джейд, которая является борцом с системой, внешне напоминающую хиппи (в целом, все персонажи, которые окружают ее - вылитые хиппи), с зелеными губами, камерой и большими амбициями, которые помогают ей спасать своих друзей и свой дом. 
Исследуйте мир с помощью своей камеры, улучшайте предметы, здоровье и другие, не менее обходимые для выживания вещи.
По ходу игры вас будет сопровождать здоровяк-хрюн Пейдж, который является инженером, сконструировавшим ваш катер, суперботинки и другие приколюхи.
Возможно, в моих воспоминаниях сидит больше, чем написано здесь. Но это отличный проект. Это потрясающая игра. Это хорошее дело, которое стоит потраченного времени, однозначно! 

10/10

Ubisoft et Michel Ancel nous proposent avec Beyond Good & Evil un jeu à l'univers fantastique et poétique, doté d'un scénario robuste et d'un gameplay de très haut niveau. Avec le mélange des styles Action, Aventure et Infiltration, et son background relativement riche, on se prend vite au jeu et les 10 heures de durée de vie moyenne (sans accomplir la totalité des quêtes annexes) passent à très grande vitesse. Bien que datant de 2003, le jeu n'a pas beaucoup vieilli et reste incontournable avec tous ses atouts : sa musique, ses personnages, ses dialogues et son univers. 
Le seul bémol sera la présence de quelques bugs graphiques et de synchronisations son/image parfois hasardeuses (malgré la qualité des doublages) pour la version PC. A faire, sur PC ou console, pour sa très grande qualité.

Combat is fairly bland, but the focus seems to be more on creating a cinematic experience than worrying too much about gameplay mechanics... and yet the voice-acting is wonky, character development is paper-thin, and the 3rd-person camera tends to be a bit stubborn. Este juego es un imprescindible, que lamentablemente no tuvo el éxito que esperaban sus creadores cuando lo lanzaron allá por 2003.

Del creador de Rayman, Michel Ancel, Beyond Good & Evil es una aventura de rol, acción, aventura e investigación, al servicio de una historia que te atrapa y no te deja ir, con personajes entrañables y de los que realmente te preocupa que lleguen vivos al final.

Porque en BG&E todo parece abocado al caos: el planeta Hillys está invadido por alienígenas asesinos, y el gobierno parece incapaz de resolver el problema. Lo peor es cuando Jade, la reportera protagonista, empieza a recibir rumores de que el Gobierno está implicado en una terrible conspiración, y es entonces cuando se inicia una carrera contrarreloj para salvar Hillys.

Si aún no concoes a Jade y sus amigos, esta es tu oportunidad. Este juego, pese al peso de los años que ya tiene, todavía desprende MAGIA, y es recomendable a gente de todas las edades. ¡Por Carlson y Peeters!

1593776.review: Beyond Good & Evil is one of the finest titles released by Ubisoft. Although it sold poorly at launch the game has since developed a sizeable following. Don't be fooled, the game's cartoony visuals belie a plot rife with conspiracy and social and political intrigue. The characters are surprisingly well-written. Jade, the game's protagonist, is notable as much for what she is as what she isn't. Jade is one of the few female leads that isn't overlty sexualized, often a problematic of video game writting. Rather, she is intelligent, strong, compassionate and unpretentious, a true everyman. In terms of gameplay, Beyond Good & Evil is a blend of action, adventure and stealth. What further sets it apart is its incorporation of photography into the plot and gameplay, breaking up the action and moving the plot forward throughout the experience. Certainly, fans of action-adventure games will find something to love about Beyond Good & Evil.

1923196.review:
Beyond Good and Evil (German: Jenseits von Gut und Böse; subtitled "Prelude to a Philosophy of the Future" (German: Vorspiel einer Philosophie der Zukunft)) is a book by the philosopher Friedrich Nietzsche, first published in 1886.

It takes up and expands on the ideas of his previous work, Thus Spoke Zarathustra, but approached from a more critical, polemical direction.

In Beyond Good and Evil, Nietzsche accuses past philosophers of lacking critical sense and blindly accepting Judeo-Christian premises in their consideration of morality. The work moves into the realm "beyond good and evil" in the sense of leaving behind the traditional morality which Nietzsche subjects to a destructive critique in favour of what he regards as an affirmative approach that fearlessly confronts the perspectival nature of knowledge and the perilous condition of the modern individual.

Admito com certa vergonha que nunca me interessei muito em ir atrás desse jogo. Mas, eis que o jogo chegou em minhas mãos (virtualmente - aliás, meu primeiro jogo do Steam), e veio o momento de jogá-lo. BG&E é muito bom e é intenso, mas talvez o que ele tenha de intenso, ele careça de profundidade. Não foram necessárias muitas horas para terminá-lo, e essas horas pareceram rasas, já que algumas delas foram fazendo algumas side-quests que não agregam muito à boa história do jogo. Além disso, o desafio e dificuldade foram baixos, contribuindo para o jogo acabar mais rápido também. Mas é aquele tipo de jogo que deixa a sensação de que foi muito bom enquanto durou. Os gráficos são bacaninhas, nada de muito avançado tecnologicamente, mas isso provavelmente pelo estilo escolhido, mais pro lado cartoon do que do realismo. Um contra quanto aos gráficos foram alguns glitches em certas partes, nada muito freqüente nem grave, mas que incomodava. Já o som é nota 10, perfeito em todos os aspectos. Excelente jogo. É sem dúvida um adventure nos moldes tradicionais mais típicos, justamente os meus favoritos. Tanto que algumas vezes lembrei de Twinsen’s Odyssey e Ocarina of Time enquanto jogava. Mas ficou devendo um pouquinho pra se equiparar a esses clássicos.

NOTA: 9/10

925466.review:
Beyond Good & Evil is a fine game. The story is good, the gameplay is great. It's a free-roam adventure, where you explore a small world and persue the story at your own pace. This game is unpretentiously fun.

Your character is a reporter investigating a grand conspiracy theme. Gameplay centers around Infiltrating government and industrial sites to capture clues and unravel the mystery. There are stealth elements, too, and occasional combat. And a sort of internal achievement system that rewards you for capturing photographs along the way of rare fauna. 

BG&E has the best sidekick characters since Grim Fandango, and a similar smart sense of humor. 

It's a console port, but the controls are decent, despite this. I finished the game with mouse and keyboard with no difficulty. The graphics are PS2-era, but they have a distinct style of their own. Jade reminds me more than a little of HL2's Alyx.

I understand that there is a "Beyond Good & Evil 2" coming soon; catch up on the storyline first.

1828781.review:
Beyond Good and Evil is one of those oddities in games. From gameplay to story, style, and even reception there's something strange in all of it, and all of it is fun. By no means is this a game you won't recognize. It borrows quite nicely from both Zelda, Metroid, Pokemon Snap, stealth games (Okay, A LOT of this game is stealth-based) and even a bit of  boat racing.

Where the oddities come in is how all of it is executed. This game has more story than Zelda and Metroid combined. The style is a bit reminiscent of Half-Life 2 in a cartoon universe (Hell, Jade even looks like Alyx Vance)

The story follows Jade as she attempts to uncover a conspiracy plot unraveling around the mysterious DomZ. Gameplay properly reflects this creeping, spy theme by having you sneaking through heavily guarded fortresses in order to snap a few incriminating photos and get the truth out to the public. There are even points in the game that thrust you into a classic action scene straight out of a movie.

1901474.review: Pretty good game that never got the rep it deserved. Not much replayability though. One playthrough and you're done. Also, multicore CPUs will need to have the game assigned to one CPU in order to play.

1453711.review: Surprisingly good Ubisoft game, from a time before multiplayer replaced single player for game focus.

180728.review:
An old game that didn't have the success it deserved when it was released. However, you can really feel a Zelda-like gameplay in a environment that is big enough to provide a sensation of "world" more than "guided map". The gampelay is perfectly designed, I've never been in a situation where I was thinking an action was missing.

The story is not childish, as you would think at first hand: it is meant to be lived by adults. And there is enough side quests to give you some entertainment besides the main story line that is by the way really epic, up to the end of the game.

I had one of my best times of gaming on this adventure game, and I really recommend it even nowadays, where it would seem that it's old: it isn't, if you take it in its own context.

3167747.review: Casual and enjoyable. Beyond Good and Evil is simply a good game with compelling story and easy-to-understand game mechanic. Fighting enemy is simple but not boring. Boss fights are quite fun, distinctive and exciting. In-game camera as plot device and tool is innovative and rewarding. Mini games and chasing sequences add up to already good contents. Memorable and unique cast of characters. Jade herself is fantastic and benevolent. The game is still as good even for present, a worth entry to add into a game collection.

358213.review:
This game is just awesome it has it all, 3D platforming, 3rd person melee combat, first person shooting (via a weapon you pick up later in the game), puzzle solving, hovercraft racing (imagine a very cut down 'Wipeout' and you're close), flying sections, space combat sections.......it's a total package. There are stealth elements here, as well as side quests and a nicely evolving story line. The graphics though a few years old still look pretty nice in my opinion. I have played this game from start to finish 3 times, the only other game in recent memory that I have played that much is Half Life 2. So I would place this game in some highly esteemed company.

On the down sides are that it can be a bit grindy (collecting items for ship upgrades), and in some situations the controls can be frustrating but in the main they work well.

One of THE most underrated games ever created... I speak these words with truth. The title, while good, was confusing. I figured at first it had to do with the Good And Evil series of games, but instead it's a moral lesson in-game. And what a game it is. This is a whirlwind trip through an entirely fresh location, with a very distinct but familiar combat system. While the sneaking is childish at times, it really is Metal Gear worthy in terms of "OHSHITDIDTHATGUYSEEMEEFUCKFUCKFUCKCAMERAOHGODLASERTURRETGRENADEOFDEATHFUUUUUUUUUUUUCK"-ness.

If you like good story-writing, sci-fi fantasy and great visual experiences, you are really missing out if you haven't bought this. This game is still GOTD for me.

We've all heard about those games.  You know the ones I'm talking about.  Those games that you can't really remember ever being advertised, yet your friends that have played them swear that those games are the greatest things since someone slathered tomato paste and cheese over bread before baking it.

Beyond Good & Evil is one of those games, and when I finally played it for the first time, it completely blew me away.  Sure, it may be dated compared to some of the gems out now, and good lord, getting it to play just right on computers these days cam be a mite... tricky.  But make no mistake, this classic is a game with the sort of story that makes you come back, just to enjoy it one more time.

Now if only Ubisoft would finish the sequel already, but of course, you can't rush quality.

1921136.review:
The Steam Overlords want recommendations.  But hey, that's fine, because an excuse to promote this game is welcome.

Don't be fooled by the somewhat retro graphics... this is a near perfect game.  It's a mixture of combat and steatlh, both quite satisfying.  The stealth elements are really good... you have to sneak past soldiers, though if your timing is good you can fight them or incapacitate them.  The situations get harder as you go; they can be quite tense.

Plus there's, well, all kinds of stuff along the way: a chase scene, hovercraft battles and races, air hockey, photography.  None of these feel like "mini-games" (except maybe the air hocky, but it's fun)-- they add variety without taking you out of the game.

Plus Jade is cute.

Go buy it so they keep working on the sequel.

1674143.review: One of the most famous cult classics in modern gaming, Beyond Good and Evil lives up to its reputation. It's not a perfect game, the controls can get annoying, the level design can be frustrating, and it's not always clear where to go next, but the game more than redeems itself with excellent characters (including one of the few truly strong female protagonists in gaming), fun puzzles, and a solid plot. Well worth playing for any fan of platforming or stealth games.
